commit_message:
Stop deployment task based on status in orchestrator

Stop deployment task shold be executed only if tasks
transmitted by orchestrator.

 - stop task manager changed for handling in_orchestrator status
 - in_orchestrator field added to task serializer (required for UI)
 - stop deployment tests fixed for handling in_orchestrator value
 - fake thread for setting in_orchestrator value added

Change-Id: I4e74da54ecd0925c3997acd7530b4b74f6ff844b
Closes-Bug: #1498827

revisions:
[{'number': 26, 'created': '2015-10-08 04:08:50.000000000', 'files': ['etc/openstack_deploy/env.d/haproxy.yml', 'etc/openstack_deploy/conf.d/haproxy.yml.example', 'doc/source/install-guide/configure-haproxy.rst', 'ansible-role-requirements.yml', 'scripts/gate-check-lint.sh', 'playbooks/vars/configs/keepalived_haproxy.yml', 'etc/openstack_deploy/user_secrets.yml', 'doc/source/install-guide/install-foundation-run.rst', 'etc/openstack_deploy/user_variables.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/hosts.yml', 'playbooks/haproxy-install.yml', 'playbooks/vars/configs/keepalived_haproxy_notifications.sh'], 'message': 'Implementation of keepalived for haproxy

This commit uses a keepalived role, available in
ansible galaxy, to configure keepalived for haproxy

Keepalived makes the haproxy truely HA, by having
haproxy's VIP highly available between the hosts
defined in the inventory.

The keepalived role configuration is fully
documented on the upstream role.

To configure keepalived on your host, you only have to
give it a variable (dict). A template handles the
generation of the configuration of keepalived.

By default, the variable files defined in vars/configs/
are enough to have a keepalived working for haproxy,
with a master-backup configuration.

You can define other variable files by setting
haproxy_keepalived_(master|backup)_vars in your
user_variables. This should point to a "variable
template" file like the one you can find
in vars/configs/*

The haproxy playbook has been changed to rely on
the dynamic generation script. It will use the env.d
to have haproxy hosts. The first host from the
generated inventory will be considered as master,
while the others are slaves. The keepalived role
will only run if more than haproxy host is found
in the inventory. This behaviour can be changed
and keepalived can be disabled by the variable:
haproxy_use_keepalived.

The implemented variables are the following:
* haproxy_keepalived_(ext|int)ernal_vip_cidr
* haproxy_keepalived_(ext|int)ernal_interface
* haproxy_keepalived_(ext|int)ernal_virtual_router_id
* haproxy_keepalived_priority_backup
* haproxy_keepalived_priority_master
* haproxy_keepalived_vars_file

In these variables, only the following variables
are necessary: keepalived_(ext|int)ernal_vip_cidr
However, it's recommended to also configure the
keepalived_(ext|int)ernal_interface
(to know which interface the vips can bind on)

Closes-Bug: 1414397
Change-Id: Ib87a3bb70d6f4b7ac9356e8a28fe4b5936eb9334
'}]
commit_message:
Implementation of keepalived for haproxy

This commit uses a keepalived role, available in
ansible galaxy, to configure keepalived for haproxy

Keepalived makes the haproxy truely HA, by having
haproxy's VIP highly available between the hosts
defined in the inventory.

The keepalived role configuration is fully
documented on the upstream role.

To configure keepalived on your host, you only have to
give it a variable (dict). A template handles the
generation of the configuration of keepalived.

By default, the variable files defined in vars/configs/
are enough to have a keepalived working for haproxy,
with a master-backup configuration.

You can define other variable files by setting
haproxy_keepalived_(master|backup)_vars in your
user_variables. This should point to a "variable
template" file like the one you can find
in vars/configs/*

The haproxy playbook has been changed to rely on
the dynamic generation script. It will use the env.d
to have haproxy hosts. The first host from the
generated inventory will be considered as master,
while the others are slaves. The keepalived role
will only run if more than haproxy host is found
in the inventory. This behaviour can be changed
and keepalived can be disabled by the variable:
haproxy_use_keepalived.

The implemented variables are the following:
* haproxy_keepalived_(ext|int)ernal_vip_cidr
* haproxy_keepalived_(ext|int)ernal_interface
* haproxy_keepalived_(ext|int)ernal_virtual_router_id
* haproxy_keepalived_priority_backup
* haproxy_keepalived_priority_master
* haproxy_keepalived_vars_file

In these variables, only the following variables
are necessary: keepalived_(ext|int)ernal_vip_cidr
However, it's recommended to also configure the
keepalived_(ext|int)ernal_interface
(to know which interface the vips can bind on)

Closes-Bug: 1414397
Change-Id: Ib87a3bb70d6f4b7ac9356e8a28fe4b5936eb9334

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-27 14:47:17.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': 'Change order of bdms in merged bdm list

If an image has vda and vdb volumes in bdm list, and a user adds a new
volume, booting an instance from the image, then vdb is assigned the new
volume with libvirt. This can cause faults of soft installed on vda (if
its settings point to vdb locations).

Previously, before bdm v2, this did work correctly. This patch fixes
this by changing the order of image and user defined bdms in result bdm
list.

Closes-Bug: #1489442
Change-Id: I3d49bc28e1d50bf528eda737bd0469ca882c71a9
'}]
commit_message:
Change order of bdms in merged bdm list

If an image has vda and vdb volumes in bdm list, and a user adds a new
volume, booting an instance from the image, then vdb is assigned the new
volume with libvirt. This can cause faults of soft installed on vda (if
its settings point to vdb locations).

Previously, before bdm v2, this did work correctly. This patch fixes
this by changing the order of image and user defined bdms in result bdm
list.

Closes-Bug: #1489442
Change-Id: I3d49bc28e1d50bf528eda737bd0469ca882c71a9

subject: Set a default value for default param
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-13 00:03:17.000000000', 'files': ['tempest_lib/auth.py'], 'message': "Set a default value for default param

This commit sets a default value for the default param in the get()
method for the Credential class. The fact that you have to set a
default breaks the assumption on a get() method where it'll default
None if there is no entry for the input parameter. This commit fixes
this by defaulting the default param to be None.

Change-Id: I4015106b76f2762d0caaf73b1525c27197f803f1
"}]
commit_message:
Set a default value for default param

This commit sets a default value for the default param in the get()
method for the Credential class. The fact that you have to set a
default breaks the assumption on a get() method where it'll default
None if there is no entry for the input parameter. This commit fixes
this by defaulting the default param to be None.

Change-Id: I4015106b76f2762d0caaf73b1525c27197f803f1

commit_message:
Make archive_deleted_rows_for_table private

archive_deleted_rows_for_table is only really used by
nova.db.sqlalchemy.api.archive_deleted_rows so it should be a private
method. The entry point to this code for nova-manage db archive_deleted_rows
is through the archive_deleted_rows method only.

Change-Id: I8ff5311c160d1190a15867721081f5193e3f4b35

subject: Show exact error message when authentication falied instead of HTML body
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-10-08 10:22:37.000000000', 'files': ['mistralclient/tests/unit/base.py', 'mistralclient/api/base.py'], 'message': "Show exact error message when authentication falied instead of HTML body

When using pecan.abort() on server side, client side will see response
bodies for HTTP errors, which is not readable for end users.

This patch will let mistral client extract error message from header
returned by mistral serivce, currently, it's only used for
authentication failure.

Closes-Bug: #1502840
Change-Id: I20a7f845676ffe23d93334d171332d717994d937
"}]
commit_message:
Show exact error message when authentication falied instead of HTML body

When using pecan.abort() on server side, client side will see response
bodies for HTTP errors, which is not readable for end users.

This patch will let mistral client extract error message from header
returned by mistral serivce, currently, it's only used for
authentication failure.

Closes-Bug: #1502840
Change-Id: I20a7f845676ffe23d93334d171332d717994d937

commit_message:
Add state info to tasks list

When publish fails for a task, the error message will be recorded in
state info. This patch refactors the task list command to include the
state info.

Change-Id: I4a02fb34d7a1f2be3f0a64a808670a35a198f139
Closes-Bug: #1496685

commit_message:
Output format is corrected for wf-validate and wb-validate

Output of workflow-validate and workbook-validate was not
correct. Now output will be displayed in tabular format
by default. Output can be customized by user by giving
format option as described in doc.

Change-Id: Ic159f188236a99acbba2d3728a74da438b90e9b2
Closes-Bug: #1499626

commit_message:
Mock oslo policy HTTPCheck instead of urllib

We were mocking internal behavior of oslo policy by
patching urllib. This will break with the upcoming oslo
release that switches to requests.

This patch changes the mock to the HTTPCheck level and we
can leave implementation details testing up to oslo_policy.

Change-Id: I07957f01307e25f1547197c720eea6e3e7f0ef5a
Closes-Bug: #1503890
(cherry picked from commit a0f1d9d6de1560be91d3001c8ac9f880a7a5a7e0)

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-08-10 04:56:29.000000000', 'files': ['specs/tempest/tempest-external-plugin-interface.rst'], 'message': "Add NOTE for tempest-external-plugin-interface

Some projects want to use tempest-external-plugin-interface for
implementing their own Tempest-like tests on the gate now.
But we will improve the design of tempest-external-plugin-interface
during Manila's development before applying it to whole projects.
So for avoiding the confusion, this patch adds NOTE to explain
current situation.

Change-Id: I43d65950cd27c0f0bbaa1334a72c1d44752af7fa
"}]
commit_message:
Add NOTE for tempest-external-plugin-interface

Some projects want to use tempest-external-plugin-interface for
implementing their own Tempest-like tests on the gate now.
But we will improve the design of tempest-external-plugin-interface
during Manila's development before applying it to whole projects.
So for avoiding the confusion, this patch adds NOTE to explain
current situation.

Change-Id: I43d65950cd27c0f0bbaa1334a72c1d44752af7fa

commit_message:
Made service broker to handle asynchronous request

In this commit murano service broker for Cloud Foundry was updated to
handle asynchronous request correctly. So, custom wsgi response
serializer was added to provide correct responses for CF API. Along with
it function for handling continious actions was implemented.

Change-Id: I2c54751f11ec5d5785b5f1e3ba155bc58c7ed0be
Closes-Bug: #1500773

commit_message:
Mock oslo policy HTTPCheck instead of urllib

We were mocking internal behavior of oslo policy by
patching urllib. This will break with the upcoming oslo
release that switches to requests.

This patch changes the mock to the HTTPCheck level and we
can leave implementation details testing up to oslo_policy.

Change-Id: I07957f01307e25f1547197c720eea6e3e7f0ef5a
Closes-Bug: #1503890
(cherry picked from commit a0f1d9d6de1560be91d3001c8ac9f880a7a5a7e0)

Add testresources used by oslo.db fixture

If we use oslo.db fixtures, we'll need the package or
the next version of oslo.db release will break us.

Closes-Bug: #1503501
Change-Id: I7dfbf240333095d91a414ba15a439bdc4804eb25
(cherry picked from commit 86ad967e40c2c6752ec0fb46cfd3098ede0c7178)

Fix functional test_server tests

Now oslo.service 0.10.0 no longer sends SIGHUP to parent and
children services.

This was a chance introduced by 286a6ea, and since it invalidated
the very logic under test, this must be revised.

(cherry picked from commit 090fe713592c2b6398d999bfa03b80cbb2054609)

Change-Id: I18a11283925369bc918002477774f196010a1bc3
Closes-bug: #1505438
(cherry picked from commit 090fe713592c2b6398d999bfa03b80cbb2054609)

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-10-09 11:27:04.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/utils/ssh_utils.py', 'mistral/actions/std_actions.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Creating new SSH action which uses gateway

 * New SSH action uses gateway for accessing to guest network VMs

 * Keys on gateway VM and target VM must be identical

commit_message:
Creating new SSH action which uses gateway

 * New SSH action uses gateway for accessing to guest network VMs
 * Connection allowed only using private key
 * Keys on gateway VM and target VM must be identical

Change-Id: I3906415eac30fae5bd6fc9e2cab70bedbb377ba9

commit_message:
Fixing ssh action to use private keys

 * Password argument is optional now
 * Ability to pass private_key to use on executors
 * Modified std.ssh docs

Closes-Bug: #1502076

Change-Id: I1e92adabafada5e45355a0e3236e8965ec921f2f
(cherry picked from commit 144d9b7a1fafd1561323dab044fbfb366f3d3bc8)

commit_message:
Replaces contextlib.nested with test.nested

contextlib.nested is deprecated in Python 2.7 and removed from
Python 3. This change will facilitate enabling Python 3 unit tests.

Enables some Python 3 unit tests in gate-nova-python34.

Partially implements blueprint: nova-python3-mitaka

Change-Id: I9b7d27be9404d5a87e4816e77649b87e09607f1b

commit_message:
use assertFalse instead of assertEqual(False, ***)

The usage of assertEqual(False, ***) should be changed to a more
meaningful format of assertFalse(***).
This patch fixes the usage for FWaaS.

Change-Id: Iac55fc1b98cebacefeb3227ca002f454bfc94f50
Related-Bug: #1503074

commit_message:
use assertIs(Not)None instead of assert(Not)Equal

Instead of using assert(Not)Equal(None, ***), developers should
use assertIs(Not)None(***). This patch fixes the same in FWaaS.

Change-Id: Ic668d09c49ebcd14f14664394c7187592722bf4c
Related-Bug: #1503055

assertEqual expects that the arguments provided to it should be
(expected, observed).If a particluar order is kept as a convention,
then it helps to provide a cleaner message to the developer if Unit Tests
fail. There are several Unit Test files where the arguments for assertEqual
have been swapped. This commit fixes the issue in fwaas.

Related-Bug: #1259292

commit_message:
Fix argument order for assertEqual to (expected, observed)

assertEqual expects that the arguments provided to it should be
(expected, observed).If a particluar order is kept as a convention,
then it helps to provide a cleaner message to the developer if Unit Tests
fail. There are several Unit Test files where the arguments for assertEqual
have been swapped. This commit fixes the issue in fwaas.

Change-Id: I3ec44666be34ee6b537437b858a80a239a9279ca
Partial-Bug: #1259292
Related-Bug: #1259292

commit_message:
docs: merge multiple interface sections with provider network section

In this guide, multiple interfaces in DevStack is only used when doing
provider networking, so let's go ahead and just put the information
inside the provider network section. That way it won't be confusing.

Change-Id: I66f58ffb936230e72ac4cf8c04668e25dac5b17a

commit_message:
Replace copy.copy with copy.deepcopy

The function copy.copy only copies reference and so if the object has dict
or nested dicts, these instances can be modified by code that has reference
to the original dict.

Change-Id: Ib2680f09b5a5d45fd7180e95ab5fedef05664c5b
Closes-Bug: #1503851
(cherry picked from commit 55540e116e7c76088c0772894df9bbe15672fd20)

subject: Remove the transaction scope from task executions API
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-13 06:17:21.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/workflow/data_flow.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_policies.py', 'mistral/api/controllers/v2/task.py', 'mistral/engine/policies.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_dataflow.py'], 'message': 'Remove the transaction scope from task executions API

Since the task execution API get_all method is in a transaction block,
if there is a lot of read against the task execution API GET method , it
will lead to unnecessary DB locks that can result in deadlocks and
consequently WF execution failures.

Change-Id: I5a6b7829176178bb6e06768e9d52e94202cf4347
Closes-Bug: #1501433
(cherry picked from commit 61ec312160e3551d7adcc8444641587e9ba83357)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the transaction scope from task executions API

Since the task execution API get_all method is in a transaction block,
if there is a lot of read against the task execution API GET method , it
will lead to unnecessary DB locks that can result in deadlocks and
consequently WF execution failures.

Change-Id: I5a6b7829176178bb6e06768e9d52e94202cf4347
Closes-Bug: #1501433
(cherry picked from commit 61ec312160e3551d7adcc8444641587e9ba83357)

commit_message:
Add unicode support for resource name

When using template which has resource name in unicode to create
stack will failed with encode/decode error.
This patch override __str__ & __unicode__ function in related
classes to make them compatible with unicode.

blueprint: template-unicode-support
Change-Id: Ie677d180d2131abd052101996900414e2b2ef4ad

commit_message:
swift-recon fails with socket.timeout exception

If some server is overloaded or timeout set too low, swift-recon fails with
raised socket.timeout exception.

This error should be processed the same way as HTTPError/URLError.

Change-Id: Ide8843977ab224fa866097d0f0b765d6899c66b8

commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertEqual

Some tests used incorrect order assertEqual(observed, expected).
The correct order expected by testtools is
assertEqual(expected, observed).

Change-Id: I5ac8602b47a747e77dc8afd579d4e280b3ed894f
Partial-Bug: #1259292
(cherry picked from commit 199dca0aeaf0d747778d19e6a273144923f6edd6)

subject: Fail task on publish error
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-13 06:02:49.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/engine/task_handler.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_task_publish.py', 'mistral/api/controllers/v2/task.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_execution_fields_size_limitation.py'], 'message': "Fail task on publish error

If there's YAQL expression evaluation error in published variables for
any task, the on_action_complete fails, DB transactions rollback, and
the task is stuck in a RUNNING state. This patch sets the task state
to ERROR and save the error message in the task state_info.

Change-Id: I9003157f57f4e649610428b046c237f8f51038fb
Closes-Bug: #1496685
(cherry picked from commit bf684b6adc93ff44f94cb6b19175bd6fde3df0a8)
"}]
commit_message:
Fail task on publish error

If there's YAQL expression evaluation error in published variables for
any task, the on_action_complete fails, DB transactions rollback, and
the task is stuck in a RUNNING state. This patch sets the task state
to ERROR and save the error message in the task state_info.

Change-Id: I9003157f57f4e649610428b046c237f8f51038fb
Closes-Bug: #1496685
(cherry picked from commit bf684b6adc93ff44f94cb6b19175bd6fde3df0a8)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1420, 'name': 'Adam Gandelman', 'email': 'adamg@ubuntu.com', 'username': 'gandelman-a'}, {'_account_id': 2592, 'name': 'Mark McClain', 'email': 'mark@mcclain.xyz', 'username': 'markmcclain'}, {'_account_id': 6287, 'name': 'David Lenwell', 'email': 'dlenwell@gmail.com', 'username': 'dlenwell'}, {'_account_id': 6923, 'name': 'Sean Roberts', 'email': 'seanroberts66@gmail.com', 'username': 'seanrob'}, {'_account_id': 8005, 'name': 'Ryan Petrello', 'email': 'ryan@ryanpetrello.com', 'username': 'ryanpetrello'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-10-13 05:25:42.000000000', 'files': ['akanda/rug/api/nova.py', 'akanda/rug/test/unit/api/test_nova_wrapper.py', 'akanda/rug/instance_manager.py', 'akanda/rug/test/unit/test_instance_manager.py'], 'message': "Track last_boot from nova server not instance_info creation

We currently only ever get an InstanceInfo's last_boot timestamp by
creating it on instantiation of an InstanceInfo object. This does
not scale to multiple Rugs and can cause quirks on cold startup of
multiple Rugs. This changes it to instead derive the last_boot
timestamp from the 'created_at' field of the Nova server.

It also removes an unused 'instance_up' attribute and adds a helper
class method for creating the InstanceInfos from novaclient objects.

Change-Id: I882412538e74cd75f31d9eb124f156cc16bfd46f
"}]
commit_message:
Track last_boot from nova server not instance_info creation

We currently only ever get an InstanceInfo's last_boot timestamp by
creating it on instantiation of an InstanceInfo object. This does
not scale to multiple Rugs and can cause quirks on cold startup of
multiple Rugs. This changes it to instead derive the last_boot
timestamp from the 'created_at' field of the Nova server.

It also removes an unused 'instance_up' attribute and adds a helper
class method for creating the InstanceInfos from novaclient objects.

Change-Id: I882412538e74cd75f31d9eb124f156cc16bfd46f

commit_message:
Replace copy.copy with copy.deepcopy

The function copy.copy only copies reference and so if the object has dict
or nested dicts, these instances can be modified by code that has reference
to the original dict.

Change-Id: Ib2680f09b5a5d45fd7180e95ab5fedef05664c5b
Closes-Bug: #1503851

subject: Add batch constraint for cluster operations
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-04 14:54:25.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/common/config.py'], 'message': "Add batch constraint for cluster operations

This patch adds a configuration option for creating/updating/deleting
cluster nodes. When creating a cluster, we may need to control the
amount of NODE_CREATE actions generated per-batch. However, we don't
have an opportunity to attach a policy to the cluster to control the
batch behavior. In this case, we will need a builtin batch control
mechanism so that we won't form a DOS attach on other services.

We can still attach a batch policy later to a cluster. In that case, the
batch size can be further constrained.

Change-Id: Ieaef07176bc4e94507d82cbd7d144d190c1fde30
"}]
commit_message:
Add batch constraint for cluster operations

This patch adds a configuration option for creating/updating/deleting
cluster nodes. When creating a cluster, we may need to control the
amount of NODE_CREATE actions generated per-batch. However, we don't
have an opportunity to attach a policy to the cluster to control the
batch behavior. In this case, we will need a builtin batch control
mechanism so that we won't form a DOS attach on other services.

We can still attach a batch policy later to a cluster. In that case, the
batch size can be further constrained.

Change-Id: Ieaef07176bc4e94507d82cbd7d144d190c1fde30

The get_sync_interfaces query will always return all router ports

commit_message:
Changed filter field to router_id

The get_sync_interfaces query will always return all router ports
from database even it is supposed to query specific ones that
belong to a certain router. In large L3 scale environment with
number of route ports in place, this would lag the response time
for adding router interface and router L3 agent binding.

Closes-Bug: #1489671
Change-Id: Ib78ca766f91783ad2ecca5b728c31602b4ed15d8
(cherry picked from commit cd524065e2ac4f48d8b9810fa9735f0fd925c4d8)

subject: Remove the transaction scope from task executions API
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-10-06 17:27:44.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/workflow/data_flow.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_policies.py', 'mistral/api/controllers/v2/task.py', 'mistral/engine/policies.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_dataflow.py'], 'message': 'Remove the transaction scope from task executions API

Since the task execution API get_all method is in a transaction block,
if there is a lot of read against the task execution API GET method , it
will lead to unnecessary DB locks that can result in deadlocks and
consequently WF execution failures.

Change-Id: I5a6b7829176178bb6e06768e9d52e94202cf4347
Closes-Bug: #1501433
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the transaction scope from task executions API

Since the task execution API get_all method is in a transaction block,
if there is a lot of read against the task execution API GET method , it
will lead to unnecessary DB locks that can result in deadlocks and
consequently WF execution failures.

Change-Id: I5a6b7829176178bb6e06768e9d52e94202cf4347
Closes-Bug: #1501433

subject: Fix argparse error in wsgi script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-05 19:38:03.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/api/wsgi.py'], 'message': 'Fix argparse error in wsgi script

In mistral/api/wsgi.py script, config.parse_args is called. By default,
oslo.config parses the CLI args if no args is provided. As a result,
invoking the WSGI script from gunicorn leads to the error with argparse
complaining that the CLI options have already been parsed.

Change-Id: Ib04325ae61759f4fc926f107f98a4eae82aec550
Closes-Bug: #1503014
'}]
commit_message:
Fix argparse error in wsgi script

In mistral/api/wsgi.py script, config.parse_args is called. By default,
oslo.config parses the CLI args if no args is provided. As a result,
invoking the WSGI script from gunicorn leads to the error with argparse
complaining that the CLI options have already been parsed.

Change-Id: Ib04325ae61759f4fc926f107f98a4eae82aec550
Closes-Bug: #1503014

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-08 18:04:37.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_policy.py'], 'message': 'Mock oslo policy HTTPCheck instead of urllib

We were mocking internal behavior of oslo policy by
patching urllib. This will break with the upcoming oslo
release that switches to requests.

This patch changes the mock to the HTTPCheck level and we
can leave implementation details testing up to oslo_policy.

Change-Id: I07957f01307e25f1547197c720eea6e3e7f0ef5a
Closes-Bug: #1503890
'}]
commit_message:
Mock oslo policy HTTPCheck instead of urllib

We were mocking internal behavior of oslo policy by
patching urllib. This will break with the upcoming oslo
release that switches to requests.

This patch changes the mock to the HTTPCheck level and we
can leave implementation details testing up to oslo_policy.

Change-Id: I07957f01307e25f1547197c720eea6e3e7f0ef5a
Closes-Bug: #1503890

commit_message:
Remove usage of expandtabs() in get_workflow_definition

There's no need to use that function for the purpose of calculating
indentation.

This patch is supplementary to the previouse patch[1], which I have
wrongly pressed workflow+1 button to have it merged. Please see my
comments there.

Fix the wrong indentation of workflow definition as well.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/225559/

Change-Id: I8daac2f81989cff83abcb01096bdf84eae5d89eb

commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertEqual

Some tests used incorrect order assertEqual(observed, expected).
The correct order expected by testtools is
assertEqual(expected, observed).

Partial-Bug: #1259292

subject: Fail task on publish error
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-18 22:42:02.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/engine/task_handler.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_task_publish.py', 'mistral/api/controllers/v2/task.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_execution_fields_size_limitation.py'], 'message': "Fail task on publish error

If there's YAQL expression evaluation error in published variables for
any task, the on_action_complete fails, DB transactions rollback, and
the task is stuck in a RUNNING state. This patch sets the task state
to ERROR and save the error message in the task state_info.

Change-Id: I9003157f57f4e649610428b046c237f8f51038fb
Closes-Bug: #1496685
"}]
commit_message:
Fail task on publish error

If there's YAQL expression evaluation error in published variables for
any task, the on_action_complete fails, DB transactions rollback, and
the task is stuck in a RUNNING state. This patch sets the task state
to ERROR and save the error message in the task state_info.

Change-Id: I9003157f57f4e649610428b046c237f8f51038fb
Closes-Bug: #1496685

revisions:

When duplicate workbook or workflow is created,
html respose is sent because content type
of result is 'plain/text'.

Code has been change to send 'application/json'
content type in case of exception is araise.

Change-Id: Icef1f8c5c615e21bb9da5a3d3bef9dacd308d242
Closes-Bug: #1501172
"}]
commit_message:
Customized response sent in case of fault condition.

When duplicate workbook or workflow is created,
html respose is sent because content type
of result is 'plain/text'.

Code has been change to send 'application/json'
content type in case of exception is araise.

Change-Id: Icef1f8c5c615e21bb9da5a3d3bef9dacd308d242
Closes-Bug: #1501172

commit_message:
[install] Liberty updates for cinder

Update cinder configuration for Liberty. Includes moving
basic host configuration of the block storage node to
environment section. Also addresses some consistency
issues, mostly from the RST conversion.

Changes and testing specific to distribution packages
primarily involve Ubuntu. Other distributions may require
additional patches.

Change-Id: I8915bc5fad5d278fd73899476bf6d90970d18564
Implements: bp installguide-liberty

pyinotify does not work on windows or osx

platforms only:
https://github.com/seb-m/pyinotify/blob/master/setup.py#L28

commit_message:
Add Ops:Packaged Tag

As discussed at the summit, a first simple tag to achieve would
be ops:packaged, which provides information to operators regarding
the existence and quality of packages for the project in distributions.

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-ops-tags

Change-Id: Ie24ba41fabe439358f090cca4ec976c6eae48ef6

a flavor according to the specified value.
At that time, horizon should specify the same value

'}]
commit_message:
Flavor id should be the same as the last one when updating

When updating the flavor, horizon delete and recreate
a flavor according to the specified value.
At that time, horizon should specify the same value
as the previous value to flavor id.

Closes-Bug: #1502804
Change-Id: Ib3ecfcb3b04421d0a2bc2a77c78ff59ecac8cfb1

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-12 17:13:03.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_build.py', 'docker/gnocchi/gnocchi-api/extend_start.sh', 'docker/gnocchi/gnocchi-api/Dockerfile.j2', 'docker/gnocchi/gnocchi-api/config-external.sh', 'docker/gnocchi/gnocchi-statsd/config-external.sh', 'etc/kolla/kolla-build.conf', 'docker/gnocchi/gnocchi-base/Dockerfile.j2', 'docker/gnocchi/gnocchi-statsd/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': "Remove gnocchi from the Dockerfiles

Gocchi doesn't and hasnt built.  Since we don't have an Ansible
implementation for Gnocchi, and the Dockerfiles don't build, this
patch removes Gnocchi from the system resulting in a clean build.

Since we use git we can always later revert this patch when we
are ready to tackle gnocchi as a technology.

backport: liberty

Change-Id: Iebbc536961fa9a29c0f5ed17d971234aa73b5bab
Closes-Bug: #1478145
"}]
commit_message:
Remove gnocchi from the Dockerfiles

Gocchi doesn't and hasnt built.  Since we don't have an Ansible
implementation for Gnocchi, and the Dockerfiles don't build, this
patch removes Gnocchi from the system resulting in a clean build.

Since we use git we can always later revert this patch when we
are ready to tackle gnocchi as a technology.

backport: liberty

Change-Id: Iebbc536961fa9a29c0f5ed17d971234aa73b5bab
Closes-Bug: #1478145

commit_message:
Reject rule if assertion type unset

When the "type" of the remote rule is not present in the assertion this
should constitute a failure to match and reject the local change.

Conflicts:
	keystone/tests/unit/contrib/federation/test_utils.py
	keystone/tests/unit/mapping_fixtures.py

Change-Id: Idba9a95f31a28401b2d49545347175ee0f324ab5
Closes-Bug: #1487937
(cherry picked from commit 21b0c7e81691a513b7f6c39a71313ff06b957c94)

commit_message:
New optional_action_timer decorator

This adds a new optional_action_timer decorator for functions that may
or may not run an atomic action timer. This prevents lots of code
duplication.

commit_message:
Do not return None when get_attr if res is in SNAPSHOT/CHECK

To get attribute instead of return None if resource
is in SNAPSHOT or CHECK action.

This patch allow to get_attr for hot template version
'2013-05-23' also.

Change-Id: I318f4c158ebe0a4afbb3f0bcbe9d856d90f0a4bb
Closes-Bug: #1505054

commit_message:
Realizing SFC (2/5): Introducing alembic DB migration framework.

This patch implements alembic DB migration framework required by
networking-sfc repository for defining new data models and
realize Service Function Chaining (SFC) functionality in neutron.

Below changes are done as part of this patch-set:
 - Alembic migration framework for networking-sfc repository.
 - PEP8 changes for alembic migration check.
 - Devref document for user reference.

Co-Authored-By: Cathy Zhang <cathy.h.zhang@huawei.com>
Co-Authored-By: vikram.choudhary <vikram.choudhary@huawei.com>
Co-Authored-By: Louis Fourie <louis.fourie@huawei.com>

Change-Id: Iaa0335c54e368fc62a4dffca7f8cc43b88e89343

commit_message:
Commit a6b516ae73d6671894a5cd3246e5db026b0e6505
Author: Laucon
Date: Mon Oct 12

Update "Chapter 1. Introduction to OpenStack High Availability in OpenStack High Availability Guide" to include HA concepts in context of OpenStack

Previously, the High Availability guide did not mention that High Availability is not the default set up for Open Stack. It did not mention that High Availability might not be for every user. I added that information and explained why High Availability is not the default set up and how it can be difficult to use in some cases.

Change-Id: Ic0495a2439885b1158ad8631537000684f3fb963
Closes-Bug: 1414115

subject: Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-10-09 15:53:48.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', '.fixtures.yml', 'Rakefile', 'Gemfile'], 'message': "Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: Iadcef8079efb8c94282c5cdefb91bfa3920f3919
"}]
commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: Iadcef8079efb8c94282c5cdefb91bfa3920f3919

commit_message:
OneView Driver for Ironic

This driver that will promote integration between Ironic and the HP OneView
Management System. The driver will allow Ironic to borrow non-dedicated servers
from OneViews's inventory to provision baremetal instances with minimal common
pre-configuration, set through OneView's *Server Profile Templates*.

Co-Authored-By: Alberto Barros <albertoffb@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Andr√© Aranha <afaranha@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Caio Oliveira <caiobo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Diego Pereira <diegolp@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Gabriel Bezerra <gabrielb@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Lilia Sampaio <liliars@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Sinval Vieira <sinval@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Change-Id: Ic2fb7860e6b4f5183b6525ff7709c7616350a96a
Implements: blueprint new-ironic-driver-for-oneview
Depends-on: I914596e592477e148e642f93cfbe114464c3fe38

commit_message:
spec: Enable webmock connect to IPv4 link-local

compile and compile.with_all_deps rpsec matchers make
a call to all facts, and especially the ec2 one (this fact, try
to make a connection on the IPv4 link-local for ec2 metadata which
is incompatible with webmock restrictions), this seems to produce
random errors with puppet 3.{3,4}.x and facter 1.7.6.

Closes-bug: #1492636
Change-Id: If27fa1adca40bab7fdfcb0687b68d1524c961325

commit_message:
Avoids rebinding the same security group rules

Previously, logic has been introduced to ensure that all the given
security group rules have been applied. No need to force the rebinding
after the agent restarts.

commit_message:
Move security group setting to kubecluster.yaml

Currently security group is created for each kube masters and kube
minions. It's very redundant.
This patch moves security group setting to kubecluster.yaml to share.

Change-Id: Idb6cdb5c5c6015b29331238f7fbbcd92e1a70d83
Closes-Bug: #1499184

Correct filename for linuxbridge_agent.ini

from /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/linuxbridge_agent.conf
to /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/linuxbridge_agent.ini

commit_message:
Require oslo.cache 0.8.0

A symbol that keystone needs to switch to oslo.cache is available
as of the 0.8.0 release, so we need to bump the version in order
for keystone to switch to oslo.cache.

Change-Id: I7f9ec3331c913f890f8f7bbaf2bb9e3976aa62d8

commit_message:
add timing infrastructure to devstack

this adds a timing infrastructure to devstack to account for time
taken up by set of operations. The first instance of this is
accounting the time taken up by doing apt_get calls.

Change-Id: I855ffe9c7a75e9943106af0f70cf715c34ae25c5

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-09-29 23:49:50.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/templates/heat-kubernetes/kubecluster-fedora-ironic.yaml', 'magnum/templates/heat-kubernetes/kubemaster-fedora-ironic.yaml', 'magnum/templates/heat-kubernetes/kubeminion-fedora-ironic.yaml'], 'message': 'Configure Ironic for Kubernetes load balancer feature

Kubernetes service provides the LoadBalancer feature

This is supported through an OpenStack plugin in Kubernetes code.
Enabling this features require configuring the cluster properly for
Kubernetes to interface with Neutron.  Kubernetes backend will then
create the Neutron load balancer pool, members, VIP and monitor,
and manage the pool members as pods are added/removed from the
service.

This patch updates the Ironic heat templates to adjust the minion
name and private network name to match what Kubernetes expects.

Additional scripts are from the patch for Fedora Atomic which
this patch has a dependency on.

Partially-Implements: blueprint external-lb
Change-Id: I74eaffe280b8ed20fce432d92fa6fc29048de8a5
'}]
commit_message:
Configure Ironic for Kubernetes load balancer feature

Kubernetes service provides the LoadBalancer feature

This is supported through an OpenStack plugin in Kubernetes code.
Enabling this features require configuring the cluster properly for
Kubernetes to interface with Neutron.  Kubernetes backend will then
create the Neutron load balancer pool, members, VIP and monitor,
and manage the pool members as pods are added/removed from the
service.

This patch updates the Ironic heat templates to adjust the minion
name and private network name to match what Kubernetes expects.

Additional scripts are from the patch for Fedora Atomic which
this patch has a dependency on.

Partially-Implements: blueprint external-lb
Change-Id: I74eaffe280b8ed20fce432d92fa6fc29048de8a5

subject: Add heat template for restarting a stack
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-08 14:01:12.000000000', 'files': ['hot/mistral/templates/stack_restarter.yaml'], 'message': "Add heat template for restarting a stack

Use mistral workflow for checking status of the given stack and
recreate stack, if VM that belongs to the stack in ERROR state or
doesn't exist. Note that it is needed to allow trusts delegation in
heat for successfull creation of a trust context.

Change-Id: I0b61177539c332db0833114e29eee7c74f2ff673
"}]
commit_message:
Add heat template for restarting a stack

Use mistral workflow for checking status of the given stack and
recreate stack, if VM that belongs to the stack in ERROR state or
doesn't exist. Note that it is needed to allow trusts delegation in
heat for successfull creation of a trust context.

Change-Id: I0b61177539c332db0833114e29eee7c74f2ff673

commit_message:
Rename isolated creds to dynamic creds

Renaming the isolated_creds module to dynamic_creds module, and rename
the IsolatedCreds class to DynamicCredentialProvider in preparation

webob 1.5.0 has a change which breaks unit tests in nova, cinder

If04eedb402092ca2cc307cb52f2231493c4375a2 fixes the nova change but
is blocked by the oslo.messaging 2.6.0 bug 1505295 which would be
fixed in I45189bb8d31819e55e2955b22aa1146257578d14 but that is

Without squashing changes that we have to backport to stable/liberty

versions in nova, merge that change, then land the fix for the unit

Partial-Bug: #1505153
'}]
commit_message:
Temporarily cap webob<1.5.0 in g-r to unblock nova

webob 1.5.0 has a change which breaks unit tests in nova, cinder
and manila.

If04eedb402092ca2cc307cb52f2231493c4375a2 fixes the nova change but
is blocked by the oslo.messaging 2.6.0 bug 1505295 which would be
fixed in I45189bb8d31819e55e2955b22aa1146257578d14 but that is
failing because of the webob failure, so we have multiple blocking
issues in nova.

Without squashing changes that we have to backport to stable/liberty
and muck with the history, we can pin both webob and oslo.messaging
versions in nova, merge that change, then land the fix for the unit
tests in nova for the webob bug, and then remove the cap on webob
here (hence the TODO).

Change-Id: I7a2197102bd812557b3a40d0a24e9a1363dd0dd7
Partial-Bug: #1505153

subject: Fix run-aio-build.sh for curl one-liner
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-09 08:59:11.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/bootstrap-aio.sh', 'scripts/run-aio-build.sh', 'scripts/bootstrap-ansible.sh'], 'message': 'Fix run-aio-build.sh for curl one-liner

The developer documentation to run an AIO build includes a curl
one-liner to run the scripts/run-aio-build.sh script. However, due to
the way it sources other scripts it will fail to execute.

This change sources those scripts in a way to allow them to be run from
curl piped to bash and also from a local git checkout.

* In run-aio-build.sh it has cd to a fresh checkout so the path can be
  assumed and hard-coded.
* In bootstrap-aio.sh and bootstrap-ansible.sh we now test the existing
  behaviour first (which will work if you executed these scripts
  directly from a git checkout) or from a scripts subdirectory of the
  currrent path (which will work if you ran the curl one-liner).

Example of documentation which includes the curl one-liner:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/openstack-ansible/developer-docs/quickstart-aio.html#running-an-aio-build-in-one-step

The curl one-liner:
curl https://raw.githubusercontent.com/openstack/openstack-ansible/master/scripts/run-aio-build.sh | sudo bash

Closes-Bug: #1504198
Change-Id: I2f8629f7cc4a1b650e8b5f6c6881168c0c5abde0
(cherry picked from commit c88534e16966f5f0b65183e584bb6cbd3058a26e)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix run-aio-build.sh for curl one-liner

The developer documentation to run an AIO build includes a curl
one-liner to run the scripts/run-aio-build.sh script. However, due to
the way it sources other scripts it will fail to execute.

This change sources those scripts in a way to allow them to be run from
curl piped to bash and also from a local git checkout.

* In run-aio-build.sh it has cd to a fresh checkout so the path can be
  assumed and hard-coded.
* In bootstrap-aio.sh and bootstrap-ansible.sh we now test the existing
  behaviour first (which will work if you executed these scripts
  directly from a git checkout) or from a scripts subdirectory of the
  currrent path (which will work if you ran the curl one-liner).

Example of documentation which includes the curl one-liner:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/openstack-ansible/developer-docs/quickstart-aio.html#running-an-aio-build-in-one-step

The curl one-liner:
curl https://raw.githubusercontent.com/openstack/openstack-ansible/master/scripts/run-aio-build.sh | sudo bash

Closes-Bug: #1504198
Change-Id: I2f8629f7cc4a1b650e8b5f6c6881168c0c5abde0
(cherry picked from commit c88534e16966f5f0b65183e584bb6cbd3058a26e)

subject: Remove auth headers in AuthProtocol
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-10-08 07:27:48.000000000', 'files': ['keystonemiddleware/tests/unit/auth_token/test_base_middleware.py', 'keystonemiddleware/auth_token/__init__.py'], 'message': "Remove auth headers in AuthProtocol

remove_auth_headers is the function that removes all the
HTTP_X_PROJECT_ID and similar authentication headers from an incoming
request so that you can't fake authentication to a service.

It turns out that we pass X-Project-Id and X-Domain-Id domain headers to
keystone for tokenless auth (and keystone doesn't use those headers
otherwise anyway) so if we want to use auth_token middleware in keystone
we only want to strip headers in the AuthProtocol subclass.

Change-Id: I5f0ea022156d0aaff4b3dc71c1cba981687723c9
"}]
commit_message:
Remove auth headers in AuthProtocol

remove_auth_headers is the function that removes all the
HTTP_X_PROJECT_ID and similar authentication headers from an incoming
request so that you can't fake authentication to a service.

It turns out that we pass X-Project-Id and X-Domain-Id domain headers to
keystone for tokenless auth (and keystone doesn't use those headers
otherwise anyway) so if we want to use auth_token middleware in keystone
we only want to strip headers in the AuthProtocol subclass.

Change-Id: I5f0ea022156d0aaff4b3dc71c1cba981687723c9

subject: Finally remove the global except handler
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-24 14:00:47.000000000', 'files': ['keystonemiddleware/tests/unit/auth_token/test_auth_token_middleware.py', 'keystonemiddleware/auth_token/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Finally remove the global except handler

The global except handler has hidden problems for too long. Every typing
mistake would get caught and returned as a token validation failure.

Now it should only be catching errors from the online validation we can
narrow it further and say the only reason we should be putting invalid
statements in the cache is that there has been an actual validation
failure.

Change-Id: I42e6d8b673b7b92666bd3d9fd7910e6dee81d1ba
'}]
commit_message:
Finally remove the global except handler

The global except handler has hidden problems for too long. Every typing
mistake would get caught and returned as a token validation failure.

Now it should only be catching errors from the online validation we can
narrow it further and say the only reason we should be putting invalid
statements in the cache is that there has been an actual validation
failure.

Change-Id: I42e6d8b673b7b92666bd3d9fd7910e6dee81d1ba

subject: Add os-client-config functional testing
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-18 05:41:51.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/os-client-config.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Add os-client-config functional testing

There's been a number of issues recently with not recognizing problems
in os-client-config problems until a release has been made. Run tempest
on every job.

Note that tempest itself won't tell us anything at all about
os-client-config. We just need the devstack part to complete and know it
was set up correctly.

Change-Id: Ic8a1d9877f89467c342d9a491886c9587d6f9a13
Related-bug: #1484373
Related-bug: #1496624
"}]
commit_message:
Add os-client-config functional testing

There's been a number of issues recently with not recognizing problems
in os-client-config problems until a release has been made. Run tempest
on every job.

Note that tempest itself won't tell us anything at all about
os-client-config. We just need the devstack part to complete and know it
was set up correctly.

Change-Id: Ic8a1d9877f89467c342d9a491886c9587d6f9a13
Related-bug: #1484373
Related-bug: #1496624

commit_message:
Add OpenFixture and get rid of 'open' mocks

This patch adds a new fixture that allows a specific
file to be mocked for 'open' calls while leaving the
normal 'open' behavior for everything else. This is to
prevent cases like the related bug where a library we
depend on can unexpectedly call 'open' on its own
(in that case it was debtcollector->warnings->linecache).

It also replaces all open mocks in the unit tests with
this new fixture.

Related-Bug: #1503847
Change-Id: Ie9e1a01acd5cb231718efd028d30df6c8dbcd3f0

In VMTask scenario, There are nested atomic actions.
 - vm.attach_floating_ip
    - nova.associate_floating_ip
 - vm.delete_floating_ip
    - nova.dissociate_floating_ip
But atomic actions should be removed.
So This patch fixed for nested atomic actions

Closes-Bug: #1505074

commit_message:
Fix nested atomic action in VMTask scenario

In VMTask scenario, There are nested atomic actions.
 - vm.attach_floating_ip
    - nova.associate_floating_ip
 - vm.delete_floating_ip
    - nova.dissociate_floating_ip
But atomic actions should be removed.
So This patch fixed for nested atomic actions
by disabling atomic aciton in nova.XX_floating_ip.

Change-Id: I3c0e31c77c3181d8403c1a5570c78d2c7e9e5cf9
Closes-Bug: #1505074

commit_message:
Release oslo.db 3.0.0

Commit 30cb7372565e505e262b4f6b83f75ecf1f8a7f81 added the
oslo.db[fixtures] install target for getting the oslo.db test fixtures
code at runtime. Since this is a backward incompatible change it
triggers a major version bump

Changes since 2.6.0:

e00868d Fix coverage configuration and execution
97ed8f2 Add universal wheel tag to setup.cfg
340c425 No need for Oslo Incubator Sync
7a52dcf Updated from global requirements

e501a56 Handle case where oslo_db.tests has not been imported

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-09 20:31:46.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/test_discover/plugins.py'], 'message': "Handle exceptions from plugins gracefully

If a tempest plugin is poorly constructed and raises an exception
during register_opts this can interfere with the rest of tempest
running correctly. This commit makes the tempest plugin handling
a bit more defensive so things don't crash if a plugin raises an

Change-Id: Ic133eee1cced5ca3c53334d3d30c7b0b043ff789
"}]
commit_message:
Handle exceptions from plugins gracefully

If a tempest plugin is poorly constructed and raises an exception
during register_opts this can interfere with the rest of tempest
running correctly. This commit makes the tempest plugin handling
a bit more defensive so things don't crash if a plugin raises an
exception, instead the error is logged and tempest moves on.

Change-Id: Ic133eee1cced5ca3c53334d3d30c7b0b043ff789

commit_message:
Added shippable venv capabilities

This change allows the repo server to create all of the venvs
within its own server environment and provides the ability for all
of the target roles to download a prebuilt venv if one is available
else it will create them on the fly.

Change-Id: Ifce0e347e5dd5001549574589ab9b129c93c4345
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Remove 'shared' from Neutron Firewall table

Neutron FWaaS firewall object does not support 'shared' attribute
at now and 'shared' attribute is not included in API response.
This commmit removes 'shared' attribute for firewall object.
For more detail of the background, please see the bug report.

Note that 'shared' attributes for firewall rule and policy
are supported. This commit only affect the firewall object.

(Pulled from gate, failing unit tests)

Change-Id: I5787529395e0005ce1efee48beb6f0f688c1c736
Closes-Bug: #1465440
(cherry picked from commit 991d8ac86c12fa45e1275851711d6feb2d9891a2)

commit_message:
Add __bool__ for classes that implement __nonzero__

__nonzero__ has been renamed to __bool__ in python3.4. So add the
__bool__ magic method that will in turn call the existing __nonzero__
method.

Change-Id: I3479564c57316733a9c30d97504ceac74771bfd4

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-12 20:08:27.000000000', 'files': ['akanda/rug/instance_manager.py', 'akanda/rug/test/unit/test_instance_manager.py'], 'message': 'Fix bad string replacement

In a previous patch, some bad string replacement messed up config
registration, causing error_cooldown to stop working.  This fixes it
and updates the instance_manager to inherit the RugTestBase, which
would have caught the issue in test.  This also requires a couple
of minor tweaks to existing tests.

Change-Id: I80a481d758e444b6146ef3597dd8f339bde9317c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bad string replacement

In a previous patch, some bad string replacement messed up config
registration, causing error_cooldown to stop working.  This fixes it
and updates the instance_manager to inherit the RugTestBase, which
would have caught the issue in test.  This also requires a couple
of minor tweaks to existing tests.

Change-Id: I80a481d758e444b6146ef3597dd8f339bde9317c

subject: Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-10-09 16:17:37.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', '.fixtures.yml', 'Rakefile', 'Gemfile', 'spec/classes/swift_proxy_ceilometer_spec.rb'], 'message': "Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

It also fix proxy/ceilometer rspec syntax for Puppet 3.x. This change
could not be in a separated patchset since it's related to this patch.

Change-Id: I8d20b5297dde8a2ecfcaf3d21d221735bc9df8d6
"}]
commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

It also fix proxy/ceilometer rspec syntax for Puppet 3.x. This change
could not be in a separated patchset since it's related to this patch.

Change-Id: I8d20b5297dde8a2ecfcaf3d21d221735bc9df8d6

commit_message:
fix html-page-context event handler

The event handler should return a string if it wants to replace the
template, but should otherwise return None and update the context in
place.

Change-Id: Ic4b19c7d19eda866ba139913cf817c99a65c8c08
Closes-Bug: #1505311

commit_message:
Drop fixtures usage

* delete .fixtures.yml
* add openstack/ to .gitignore

commit_message:
py3: Replace gen.next() with next(gen)

The next() method of Python 2 generators was renamed to __next__().
Call the builtin next() function instead which works on Python 2 and
Python 3.

The patch was generated by the next operation of the sixer tool.

Change-Id: Id12bc16cba7d9b8a283af0d392188a185abe439d

commit_message:
py3: Use six.reraise() to reraise an exception

Replace "raise exc_type, exc_value, exc_tb" with
"six.reraise(exc_type, exc_value, exc_tb)".

The patch was generated by the raise operation of the sixer tool on:
bin/* swift/ test/.

Change-Id: Ic4ca6d7f26d1e0075bd2a8a26d6e408b59b17fbb

commit_message:
Align users with list/search/get interface

This replaces: Ibca7240efe705c35bf7a17898caba5a4531bc858

Changes include:
  - Support for the list/search/get methods.
  - Fixes a bug in user create.
  - Allow updating user name and some keystone v3 attributes.
  - delete_user() method is aligned to return True if the
    delete succeeded, False if the user was not found.
  - Test all the things.

Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>

Change-Id: I2f1296a0247ad33e5cb6b2d67559165a55592fd3

subject: Download forbidden when get_image_location is set.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-01 16:33:37.000000000', 'files': ['glance/api/v2/image_data.py', 'glance/location.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v2/test_image_data_resource.py'], 'message': "Download forbidden when get_image_location is set.

When using v2 an attempt to download an image would return a 403 if the
get_image_location policy was set.

Note: We had been returning both 404 and 204 when no data was
available. There was no way to detect the 404 case without trying to
access the image locations so I've standardized on 204.

Change-Id: I658b08a35d3a8cb8a7096baf716ccb3d6e7d9abf
Closes-bug: 1501672
(cherry picked from commit b47f625443c3b46483506926f31fee42478705d4)
"}]
commit_message:
Download forbidden when get_image_location is set.

When using v2 an attempt to download an image would return a 403 if the
get_image_location policy was set.

Note: We had been returning both 404 and 204 when no data was
available. There was no way to detect the 404 case without trying to
access the image locations so I've standardized on 204.

Change-Id: I658b08a35d3a8cb8a7096baf716ccb3d6e7d9abf
Closes-bug: 1501672
(cherry picked from commit b47f625443c3b46483506926f31fee42478705d4)

subject: Use pip install --proxy when $HTTPS_PROXY is set
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-11 01:15:05.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/bootstrap-aio.sh', 'scripts/bootstrap-ansible.sh'], 'message': 'Use pip install --proxy when $HTTPS_PROXY is set

During execution of our bootstrap scripts, we need to install some
packages before we have constructed any of the infrastructure. In
this case when installing behind a proxy we should respect that
proxy.

When $HTTPS_PROXY is not set but $HTTP_PROXY is, that will be used
instead. The use of trusted-host or other pip configurations to
enable this usage are out of scope and can be resolved separately.

Change-Id: I3df5ef6a7d33a3357e8c00f138b019c06c6bc3d6
Closes-Bug: 1504405
(cherry picked from commit a875596ba2a0c37fff131ff6ea1f899732b0f5ce)
'}]
commit_message:
Use pip install --proxy when $HTTPS_PROXY is set

During execution of our bootstrap scripts, we need to install some
packages before we have constructed any of the infrastructure. In
this case when installing behind a proxy we should respect that
proxy.

When $HTTPS_PROXY is not set but $HTTP_PROXY is, that will be used
instead. The use of trusted-host or other pip configurations to
enable this usage are out of scope and can be resolved separately.

Change-Id: I3df5ef6a7d33a3357e8c00f138b019c06c6bc3d6
Closes-Bug: 1504405
(cherry picked from commit a875596ba2a0c37fff131ff6ea1f899732b0f5ce)

subject: Add a default config file location to the api
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-09 22:40:03.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_health/api.py'], 'message': "Add a default config file location to the api

This commit adds a default config file location at
/etc/openstack-health.conf. If a conf file path isn't provided on the
cli the api process will default to reading the config file at
/etc/openstack-health.conf, this will let us deploy the api in
scenarios where we don't have the ability to pass arguments.
The cli args method can only be used when invoking the server through
the dev/test flask test server directly, if deploying for real you
need to use /etc/openstack-health.conf for the config file.

Change-Id: I7de91197dacbec3f5b0917c27fda72b4366d37e4
"}]
commit_message:
Add a default config file location to the api

This commit adds a default config file location at
/etc/openstack-health.conf. If a conf file path isn't provided on the
cli the api process will default to reading the config file at
/etc/openstack-health.conf, this will let us deploy the api in
scenarios where we don't have the ability to pass arguments.
The cli args method can only be used when invoking the server through
the dev/test flask test server directly, if deploying for real you
need to use /etc/openstack-health.conf for the config file.

Change-Id: I7de91197dacbec3f5b0917c27fda72b4366d37e4

subject: Add support for specifying swift ring directory range
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-05-01 08:07:14.000000000', 'files': ['elements/swift/os-refresh-config/configure.d/73-swift', 'elements/swift/README.md'], 'message': 'Add support for specifying swift ring directory range

We plan to allow specification of the range of directories to be
used when building the Swift rings. The range will be specified
using the bash curly brace format where the range starts with 0
or 1:  <root>{(0|1)..<end of range>}. <root> is the root name used
for the directories.  In future, we will want to mount individual
devices under the specified directories.

This element change supports the planned specification format.  It
also works with existing device lists contained in overcloud yaml
templates.  If this change is accepted there is a corresponding
Swift overcloud yaml template change which we will submit.

The yaml template change will check that the range specifier
submitted when creating the corresponding overcloud stack conforms
with the format outlined above.

Change-Id: I319baf471b902ba39196a17ce27746a8bd5f87ae
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for specifying swift ring directory range

We plan to allow specification of the range of directories to be
used when building the Swift rings. The range will be specified
using the bash curly brace format where the range starts with 0
or 1:  <root>{(0|1)..<end of range>}. <root> is the root name used
for the directories.  In future, we will want to mount individual
devices under the specified directories.

This element change supports the planned specification format.  It
also works with existing device lists contained in overcloud yaml
templates.  If this change is accepted there is a corresponding
Swift overcloud yaml template change which we will submit.

The yaml template change will check that the range specifier
submitted when creating the corresponding overcloud stack conforms
with the format outlined above.

Change-Id: I319baf471b902ba39196a17ce27746a8bd5f87ae

subject: Add support for hash-based RUG scale out
revisions:
[{'number': 27, 'created': '2015-10-09 22:08:45.000000000', 'files': ['etc/rug.ini', 'akanda/rug/state.py', 'akanda/rug/test/unit/test_rpc.py', 'akanda/rug/populate.py', 'akanda/rug/test/unit/test_worker.py', 'akanda/rug/coordination.py', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'akanda/rug/worker.py', 'akanda/rug/common/hash_ring.py', 'akanda/rug/common/rpc.py', 'akanda/rug/main.py', 'akanda/rug/test/unit/common/test_hash_ring.py', 'akanda/rug/event.py', 'devstack/files/debs/akanda-rug', 'requirements.txt', 'akanda/rug/test/unit/test_coordination.py', 'akanda/rug/test/unit/test_populate.py', 'akanda/rug/test/unit/test_state.py'], 'message': "Add support for hash-based RUG scale out

This adds support for running multiple RUG processes to scale out
and distribute appliance load across them.  It uses a hash ring implementation
lifted from Ironic (with modification).  The gist is:

* Workers now maintain a copy of the hash ring, which is hashed using the
list of members in the cluster.

* A new subprocess connects to an external coordination service via tooz, ie
memcache or zookeeper.  This service's only purpose is to track cluster
membership and report changes to this subprocess.  On membership changes,
the coordination subprocess creates a REBALANCE event and puts it on the
internal notification queue.  There is no leadership election required.

* When a worker gets a REBALANCE event, it rebalances the hash ring based
on the new membership list.

* Prior to processing any events bound for a specified router, the worker
first checks the hash manager to find if the resource is assigned to it.
If not, it ignores it.  If it is, it processes the event. This also applies
to incoming command events.

Partially implements: blueprint rug-scaling

Change-Id: I8d04100ffc0e2f2223ebf4b079551dac99224344
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for hash-based RUG scale out

This adds support for running multiple RUG processes to scale out
and distribute appliance load across them.  It uses a hash ring implementation
lifted from Ironic (with modification).  The gist is:

* Workers now maintain a copy of the hash ring, which is hashed using the
list of members in the cluster.

* A new subprocess connects to an external coordination service via tooz, ie
memcache or zookeeper.  This service's only purpose is to track cluster
membership and report changes to this subprocess.  On membership changes,
the coordination subprocess creates a REBALANCE event and puts it on the
internal notification queue.  There is no leadership election required.

* When a worker gets a REBALANCE event, it rebalances the hash ring based
on the new membership list.

* Prior to processing any events bound for a specified router, the worker
first checks the hash manager to find if the resource is assigned to it.
If not, it ignores it.  If it is, it processes the event. This also applies
to incoming command events.

Partially implements: blueprint rug-scaling

Change-Id: I8d04100ffc0e2f2223ebf4b079551dac99224344

commit_message:
tox: add a generic environment to build a RST guide

With this environment it is possible to build a single RST guide with
the following common: tox -e build -- NAME

E.g. to build the contributor guide run the following command:

tox -e build -- contributor-guide

Change-Id: I94cf504eece14b2b8d2734cb5b4c16a1b409026f

commit_message:
Fix mesos build image error

According to https://mesosphere.com/downloads/
the ubuntu 14.04 need java8 requirements. And
at the same time, we not want to use oracle jdk,
use openjdk directly. Check this for openjdk further:
https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/
pull/685/files

Change-Id: I30d5be40882b2a5a20ee537d27bcfaa0df531925
Closes-Bug: #1505078

subject: Update Flavor defaults and descriptions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-07 16:18:57.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud-without-mergepy.yaml'], 'message': 'Update Flavor defaults and descriptions

Currently only the CephStorage role defaults to "baremetal", but in
the default deployment documented in tripleo-docs, we expect all
nodes to use this Flavor.  So update the default such that clients
don't necessarily have to provide it for default setups.

This makes it easier e.g if you want to create an overcloud direct
via heatclient or some other tool that's not tripleoclient which
hard-codes these defaults internally.

Change-Id: Id53c8a629b4191ab5bae116a6f81ec71be5126a8
'}]
commit_message:
Update Flavor defaults and descriptions

Currently only the CephStorage role defaults to "baremetal", but in
the default deployment documented in tripleo-docs, we expect all
nodes to use this Flavor.  So update the default such that clients
don't necessarily have to provide it for default setups.

This makes it easier e.g if you want to create an overcloud direct
via heatclient or some other tool that's not tripleoclient which
hard-codes these defaults internally.

Change-Id: Id53c8a629b4191ab5bae116a6f81ec71be5126a8

image, so it's more convenient if we align the template defaults

subject: fix for systemd based rabbitmq guest
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-10-12 15:35:42.000000000', 'files': ['cue/templates/install_rabbit.sh.tmpl'], 'message': 'fix for systemd based rabbitmq guest

Upstart seemed to be providing output from rabbitmqctl, which we
were depending on to tell whether rabbit was up, but systemd does
not do this. Changing the status check to use rabbitmqctl instead
so that status check works for both systemd and upstart.

Also moved the command to enable the management console to after
rabbitmq startup since the command was failing if rabbit was not
up.

Change-Id: I5f0c277a3201911b0bc998ff7f17d526dab6b33e
'}]
commit_message:
fix for systemd based rabbitmq guest

Upstart seemed to be providing output from rabbitmqctl, which we
were depending on to tell whether rabbit was up, but systemd does
not do this. Changing the status check to use rabbitmqctl instead
so that status check works for both systemd and upstart.

Also moved the command to enable the management console to after
rabbitmq startup since the command was failing if rabbit was not
up.

Change-Id: I5f0c277a3201911b0bc998ff7f17d526dab6b33e

subject: Reorganize parameters per service and role
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-07 16:18:57.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud-without-mergepy.yaml'], 'message': 'Reorganize parameters per service and role

As a precursor to introducing parameter groups, reshuffle the parameters
so we have
* common/global parameters
* common service parameters (e.g RPC and DB settings)
* Per-service options for deployed services
* Per-role options for the deployed nodes
* Parameters associated with updates

Change-Id: Id7b0ad5ff7f5789682105a019411424c691c9350
'}]
commit_message:
Reorganize parameters per service and role

As a precursor to introducing parameter groups, reshuffle the parameters
so we have
* common/global parameters
* common service parameters (e.g RPC and DB settings)
* Per-service options for deployed services
* Per-role options for the deployed nodes
* Parameters associated with updates

Change-Id: Id7b0ad5ff7f5789682105a019411424c691c9350

subject: Update NeutronDhcpAgentsPerNetwork to align with ControllerCount
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-07 17:27:56.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud-without-mergepy.yaml'], 'message': "Update NeutronDhcpAgentsPerNetwork to align with ControllerCount

In tripleoclient we correlate the NeutronDhcpAgentsPerNetwork with the
number of controllers, capped to 3.  So given that the template
defaults the ControllerCount to 1, 1 seems like a more consistent
value for NeutronDhcpAgentsPerNetwork, and it's consistent with
python-tripleoclient.

Change-Id: I04ada4a3fc0ec5f234139b67a6d1c3103d565666
"}]
commit_message:
Update NeutronDhcpAgentsPerNetwork to align with ControllerCount

In tripleoclient we correlate the NeutronDhcpAgentsPerNetwork with the
number of controllers, capped to 3.  So given that the template
defaults the ControllerCount to 1, 1 seems like a more consistent
value for NeutronDhcpAgentsPerNetwork, and it's consistent with
python-tripleoclient.

Change-Id: I04ada4a3fc0ec5f234139b67a6d1c3103d565666

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-12 17:11:25.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py.example'], 'message': 'Introduce DEFAULT_SERVICE_REGIONS

It should be together with related change in django-openstack-auth, if
specified it will change the default service region calculation: it
will be taken from this setting (on a per-endpont basis) instead of a
value stored in cookies.  This value is still checked for sanity,
i.e. it should be present in Keystone service catalog.

Change-Id: I0f8c35337c837c137c07e07d9aae3e591e5e2333
Partial-bug: #1452722
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce DEFAULT_SERVICE_REGIONS

It should be together with related change in django-openstack-auth, if
specified it will change the default service region calculation: it
will be taken from this setting (on a per-endpont basis) instead of a
value stored in cookies.  This value is still checked for sanity,
i.e. it should be present in Keystone service catalog.

Change-Id: I0f8c35337c837c137c07e07d9aae3e591e5e2333
Partial-bug: #1452722

commit_message:
Heat Stacks Details: Events table doesn't show up

It shows a loading sign.
There is an AttributeError because event_list does not return
with any 'resource_type' to map. Since it doesn't make any sense,
removed the resource_to_url link, and also add a check in the method.

Change-Id: Ic94cffaa2450bbee3f9c9dabcaffb03a6cdc3b46
Closes-Bug: #1493216

commit_message:
Fixing template filtering by plugin name

Filtering the node group templates and cluster templates
tables by plugin was failing because it was using the
incorrect field name.  It has now been updated to search
against "plugin_name", which is correct.

Change-Id: I41760fa9cfa714cf1c9ae90229cb48ff759289fc
Closes-Bug: #1503235

Without NTPD, rabbitmq reconnects often and generally causes havoc
in an OpenStack installation.

This removes the use of UI components from the openstack library,
making it reusable outside of ironic-webclient. It is mainly achieved by
removing the addLocal invocation of $modal from $$configuration, nad

to the ironic root application module. Tests for the

commit_message:
Separated UI and Configuration Logic

This removes the use of UI components from the openstack library,
making it reusable outside of ironic-webclient. It is mainly achieved by
removing the addLocal invocation of $modal from $$configuration, nad
moving the ConfigurationAddController from the openstack module
to the ironic root application module. Tests for the
ConfigurationAddController have been also added, and the test
threshold has been raised accordingly.

Change-Id: Icfd7504be966cee330a934c99b50465fd8ff7993

subject: [stable/7.0]Improve 'run_on_remote' for more general use
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6719, 'name': 'tatyana-leontovich', 'email': 'tleontovich@mirantis.com', 'username': 'tatyana-leontovich'}, {'_account_id': 8882, 'name': 'Nastya Urlapova', 'email': 'aurlapova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'NastyaUrlapova'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10136, 'name': 'Andrey Sledzinskiy', 'email': 'asledzinskiy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'asledzinskiy'}, {'_account_id': 11969, 'name': 'Dennis Dmitriev', 'email': 'dis.xcom@gmail.com', 'username': 'ddmitriev'}, {'_account_id': 14708, 'name': 'Maksym Strukov', 'email': 'unbelll@gmail.com', 'username': 'mstrukov'}, {'_account_id': 17251, 'name': 'Tatyana', 'inactive': True}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-10-07 21:21:39.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/helpers/utils.py'], 'message': "[stable/7.0]Improve 'run_on_remote' for more general use

Author: Maksym Strukov
To use method in cases when ec is expected to be not zero and reduce
duplicated code in asserts messages new parameters in 'run_on_remote'
method proposed with following logic:
* 'assert_ec_equal' with default '[0]'. Error message will be logged only
when exit_code != assert_ec_equal. Can pass xrange(1,8) or [1, 4, 5]
* 'raise_on_assert' with default 'True'. Exception now can be
surpressed when exit_code != assert_ec_equal if 'raiseOnAssert' is 'False'

Also:
* 'run_on_remote_get_results' return dict with:
  'command',
  'host',
  'stdout',
  'stdout_str',
  'stdout_len',
  'stdout_json', if jsonify=true
  'stderr',
  'stderr_str',
  'stderr_len',
  'exit_code', instead of just stdout string
* 'run_on_remote' wrapper leaved for compatibility

Change-Id: I32a9d743929d01857a88844976074df719d9880a
Closes-Bug: #1489165
(cherry picked from commit 32b6bc8cea5c595aa92e2c2c825762b53c49e191)
"}]
commit_message:
[stable/7.0]Improve 'run_on_remote' for more general use

Author: Maksym Strukov
To use method in cases when ec is expected to be not zero and reduce
duplicated code in asserts messages new parameters in 'run_on_remote'
method proposed with following logic:
* 'assert_ec_equal' with default '[0]'. Error message will be logged only
when exit_code != assert_ec_equal. Can pass xrange(1,8) or [1, 4, 5]
* 'raise_on_assert' with default 'True'. Exception now can be
surpressed when exit_code != assert_ec_equal if 'raiseOnAssert' is 'False'

Also:
* 'run_on_remote_get_results' return dict with:
  'command',
  'host',
  'stdout',
  'stdout_str',
  'stdout_len',
  'stdout_json', if jsonify=true
  'stderr',
  'stderr_str',
  'stderr_len',
  'exit_code', instead of just stdout string
* 'run_on_remote' wrapper leaved for compatibility

Change-Id: I32a9d743929d01857a88844976074df719d9880a
Closes-Bug: #1489165
(cherry picked from commit 32b6bc8cea5c595aa92e2c2c825762b53c49e191)

subject: Add 'deactivated' status to image schema.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-12 12:40:27.000000000', 'files': ['glance/api/v2/images.py'], 'message': "Add 'deactivated' status to image schema.

New 'deactivated' status was introduced in Kilo release,
but it doesn't listed in available image statuses in the schema.

It leads to issues  on the client side, when it can't validate
the image with this status against the schema and returns the error.

Change-Id: I5ec264614ae7ecf54b846ad0600442a18c61d24c
Closes-bug: #1505218
Related-bug: #1505134
"}]
commit_message:
Add 'deactivated' status to image schema.

New 'deactivated' status was introduced in Kilo release,
but it doesn't listed in available image statuses in the schema.

It leads to issues  on the client side, when it can't validate
the image with this status against the schema and returns the error.

Change-Id: I5ec264614ae7ecf54b846ad0600442a18c61d24c
Closes-bug: #1505218
Related-bug: #1505134
