subject: [Docker] Do not try to delete container on destroyed host
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-12 11:23:27.000000000', 'files': ['Docker/Kubernetes/KubernetesCluster/package/Classes/KubernetesCluster.yaml', 'Docker/DockerStandaloneHost/package/Classes/DockerStandaloneHost.yaml', 'Docker/DockerInterfacesLibrary/package/Classes/DockerApplication.yaml', 'Docker/Kubernetes/KubernetesPod/package/Classes/KubernetesPod.yaml', 'Docker/Kubernetes/KubernetesCluster/package/Classes/KubernetesMasterNode.yaml'], 'message': '[Docker] Do not try to delete container on destroyed host

When Environment get deleted both Docker/k8s host and
Docker applications get deleted. So it is possible that host
will try to delete container from an Instance that was already
destroyed. Attempt to send commands to such instance
will hang until timeout because there is no more agent
exist on the other side.

Change-Id: Ia6e8064ae50c24ce595ed08e446ed45b96b4a330
Closes-Bug: #1504623
Depends-On: I298f3f079a153ef87ed7213b7f1432c9e5e4b4b6
'}]
commit_message:
[Docker] Do not try to delete container on destroyed host

When Environment get deleted both Docker/k8s host and
Docker applications get deleted. So it is possible that host
will try to delete container from an Instance that was already
destroyed. Attempt to send commands to such instance
will hang until timeout because there is no more agent
exist on the other side.

Change-Id: Ia6e8064ae50c24ce595ed08e446ed45b96b4a330
Closes-Bug: #1504623
Depends-On: I298f3f079a153ef87ed7213b7f1432c9e5e4b4b6

commit_message:
Improve saving confirmation dialog

- If there is validation error, do not allow to save changes
- If saving failed, show error message instead of closing
  the dialog silently

Change-Id: I4e849d21eca429b7bd3b9ad0edeb6e3d4113f855

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7225, 'name': 'Serg Melikyan', 'email': 'smelikyan@mirantis.com', 'username': 'smelikyan'}, {'_account_id': 7535, 'name': 'Nikolay Starodubtsev', 'email': 'starodubcevna@gmail.com', 'username': 'Kezar'}, {'_account_id': 7549, 'name': 'Ekaterina Chernova', 'email': 'katyafervent@yandex.ru', 'username': 'efedorova'}, {'_account_id': 7821, 'name': 'Murano CI', 'username': 'murano-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12597, 'name': 'Lin Yang', 'email': 'lin.a.yang@intel.com', 'username': 'lin.yang'}, {'_account_id': 13962, 'name': 'Victor Ryzhenkin', 'email': 'vryzhenkin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vryzhenkin'}, {'_account_id': 15168, 'name': 'Kirill Zaitsev', 'email': 'k.zaitsev@me.com', 'username': 'kzaitsev'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-09 22:35:01.000000000', 'files': ['meta/io.murano/Classes/resources/Instance.yaml', 'meta/io.murano/Classes/resources/HeatSWConfigInstance.yaml'], 'message': "Do not try to delete server from deleted Heat stack

Because now Environment's .destroy method would
be called before that of an Instance the later will try
to delete itself from the stack that is physically not
existing and represented as an empty dictionary in
HeatStack.current().

With this change Instance will check stack existence
before deleting anything.

Also a method to check if Instance is present in Heat
stack template was added so that application could check
if it is safe to use the instance (for example to send Agent plans)

Change-Id: I298f3f079a153ef87ed7213b7f1432c9e5e4b4b6
Closes-Bug: #1503715
"}]
commit_message:
Do not try to delete server from deleted Heat stack

Because now Environment's .destroy method would
be called before that of an Instance the later will try
to delete itself from the stack that is physically not
existing and represented as an empty dictionary in
HeatStack.current().

With this change Instance will check stack existence
before deleting anything.

Also a method to check if Instance is present in Heat
stack template was added so that application could check
if it is safe to use the instance (for example to send Agent plans)

Change-Id: I298f3f079a153ef87ed7213b7f1432c9e5e4b4b6
Closes-Bug: #1503715

Currently logging configuration is splitted in two distinct classes, the
init.pp and the logging.pp classes. This review aims to centralize all
logging related parameters in a single class, the logging.pp one.

The impacted parameters are :

  * use_syslog
  * use_stderr
  * log_facility

commit_message:
Put all the logging related parameters to the logging class

Currently logging configuration is splitted in two distinct classes, the
init.pp and the logging.pp classes. This review aims to centralize all
logging related parameters in a single class, the logging.pp one.

The impacted parameters are :

  * use_syslog
  * use_stderr
  * log_facility
  * verbose
  * debug
  * log_dir

This change remains backward compatible with what is currently in place

Change-Id: Ia040f7c935941da0b747cf3e8b5eda1abf2ae07a

commit_message:
Add agent_amt driver

This combines the AgentDeploy deploy driver with the AMT power and
management drivers, to allow the agent-based deploy mechanism on AMT
hardware.

Co-Authored-By: Devananda van der Veen <devananda.vdv@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1499489
Implements: blueprint agent-amt-driver
Change-Id: Ideaa68d97477a9a924c33e76b4da3aa8fb02f503

commit_message:
Update Keystone Configuration for Liberty

This patch includes the following updates based on the updated
source in Keystone's Liberty release:
 - keystone-paste.ini
 - policy.json

The following defaults have their values changed in order to
accommodate Keystone's configuration method for the Liberty release.
Note that any user_variables.yml values that have been set to
customise these will need to be reviewed and adjusted accordingly
for Liberty.
 - keystone_identity_driver
 - keystone_token_driver
 - keystone_token_provider
 - keystone_revocation_driver
 - keystone_assignment_driver
 - keystone_resource_driver
 - keystone_ldap_identity_driver

DocImpact
UpgradeImpact
Implements: blueprint liberty-release
Change-Id: Ib6f6c933c5d300057926143c9aa964bac292be08

commit_message:
Update settings during deploying an IBMi VM.

IBMi VM depends on tagged io, ipl source and keylock position to determine
PowerOn mode. During deploying an new IBMi VM, tagged io, IPL source and
keylock position must be set. This change set will add a new task in
spawn flow to set those required attributes for IBMi.
Change-Id: Idd5a305ff9aa6de11920fbc61099a10a0b2df748

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Ji≈ô√≠ Str√°nsk√Ω', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 9410, 'name': 'Yanis Guenane', 'email': 'yguenane@redhat.com', 'username': 'yguenane'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-10-12 09:56:52.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud-without-mergepy.yaml', 'puppet/controller.yaml', 'puppet/hieradata/controller.yaml'], 'message': 'Allow one to specify horizon ALLOWED_HOSTS

If horizon is running in production (DEBUG is False), it will answer
only to the IPs/hostnames specified in the ALLOWED_HOSTS variable in the
local_settings.py configuration file.

The puppet-horizon module offer the feature to customize that,
tripleo-heat-teamplates was missing the link between the top-level
parameter and the puppet parameter, hence this commit.

More info :

 * https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/ref/settings/#allowed-hosts
 * https://github.com/openstack/puppet-horizon/blob/master/templates/local_settings.py.erb#L14-L24

Change-Id: I5faede8b74a0318e15baa761dc502b95b051ae0d
'}]
commit_message:
Allow one to specify horizon ALLOWED_HOSTS

If horizon is running in production (DEBUG is False), it will answer
only to the IPs/hostnames specified in the ALLOWED_HOSTS variable in the
local_settings.py configuration file.

The puppet-horizon module offer the feature to customize that,
tripleo-heat-teamplates was missing the link between the top-level
parameter and the puppet parameter, hence this commit.

More info :

 * https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/ref/settings/#allowed-hosts
 * https://github.com/openstack/puppet-horizon/blob/master/templates/local_settings.py.erb#L14-L24

Change-Id: I5faede8b74a0318e15baa761dc502b95b051ae0d

commit_message:
Change the way devstack configures murano-dashboard

Due to change in horizon settings file, we need to change
the method of murano-dashboard configutration. Murano dashboard lib
will now put config into local_settings.py file of Horizon.

commit_message:
Moving rsyslog to librarian

This change moves the rsyslog module to librarian. This change also
updates the rsyslog module to v3.5.1 from our customized 1.1.4 version.
With the update, our usage of file resources to manage syslog
configuration files has also been updated to leverage the
rsyslog::snippet resource.

This change also cleans up the lint issues with the openstack::logging
class.

Partial blueprint: fuel-puppet-librarian

Change-Id: I6734f8415940c5b1869eca442ce72534db8ff3d2

commit_message:
Adding MAINTAINERS to fuel-upgrade

In a consensus reached in a proposal for code review process
change [1], and proposed team structure policy document [2],
adding MAINTAINERS files in repositories.
Please note, that this file is written in YAML format in order
to allow further automation around code review process.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-August/072406.html
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/225376/1

Change-Id: If492a8fa12d83a6fa256c387d296d48c4cc450d1
Co-Authored-By: Mike Scherbakov <mscherbakov@mirantis.com>

Replace image property 'is-public' on 'visibility'

Since liberty glance client uses v2 glance-api version and there is
no such property 'is-public'. It is replaced on 'visibility'.

Change-Id: I9ac535a0eecba0ecc890a020677dc86e8c000df1
Related-bug: #1503790

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 9878, 'name': 'Zack M. Davis', 'email': 'zdavis@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'zackmdavis'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15343, 'name': 'Tim Burke', 'email': 'tburke@nvidia.com', 'username': 'tburke'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-10-08 23:39:42.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/direct_client.py', 'swift/common/exceptions.py'], 'message': "minut√¶: port ClientException tweaks from swiftclient; dict .pop

openstack/python-swiftclient@5ae4b423 changed python-swiftclient's
ClientException to have its http_status attribute default to
None (rather than 0) and to use super in its __init__ method. For
consistency's sake, it's nice for Swift's inlined copy of
ClientException to receive the same patch. Also, the retry function in
direct_client (a major user of ClientException) was using a somewhat
awkward conditional-assignment-and-delete construction where the .pop
method of dictionaries would be more idiomatic.

Change-Id: I70a12f934f84f57549617af28b86f7f5637bd8fa
"}]
commit_message:
minut√¶: port ClientException tweaks from swiftclient; dict .pop

openstack/python-swiftclient@5ae4b423 changed python-swiftclient's
ClientException to have its http_status attribute default to
None (rather than 0) and to use super in its __init__ method. For
consistency's sake, it's nice for Swift's inlined copy of
ClientException to receive the same patch. Also, the retry function in
direct_client (a major user of ClientException) was using a somewhat
awkward conditional-assignment-and-delete construction where the .pop
method of dictionaries would be more idiomatic.

Change-Id: I70a12f934f84f57549617af28b86f7f5637bd8fa

commit_message:
rest: Always return complete exceptions.

On 400, instead of sometime returning the indexer exception
and sometimes just a raw 404.

This change raises everywhere indexer exceptions.

Change-Id: Ieb8b3f916556528d7a2db2020d5d0e36d91ad332

subject: use less generic variable for iteration
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-12 11:35:16.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common'], 'message': "use less generic variable for iteration

Using i for iteration is dangerous if you do a ``source`` inside the
function, because it means someone else's non localized use of i might
change that value later. This happens in the ironic case.

Change-Id: I798630edf832a4e930d65853d48b0bab529c5a1e
"}]
commit_message:
use less generic variable for iteration

Using i for iteration is dangerous if you do a ``source`` inside the
function, because it means someone else's non localized use of i might
change that value later. This happens in the ironic case.

Change-Id: I798630edf832a4e930d65853d48b0bab529c5a1e

We attempt to log every successful metadata response with LOG.debug. But
as per oslo.log docs [1], we should make sure that what we pass into the
library is unicode.

Http.request returns a tuple of Response object and a string, which is
bytes in Python 2.x [2].

That's why we need to convert the response content to unicode before
passing it into oslo.log.

To achieve it, we utilize encodeutils.safe_decode with 'replace' errors
handling strategy, so that we don't get exceptions on input that does
not conform unicode.

For the unit test case, we pass a string that is not expected to convert
to unicode with errors='strict' strategy or similar, and check that we
still don't crash.

While at it, we remove a check for the number of log calls being
triggered, because it's something that we should avoid validating in
test cases, and it cannot trigger a real bug. The mock that was used to
count the number would also hide the bug that we try to reproduce.

Note that the bug does not require debug to be set because the crash
occurs before oslo.log machinery decides it should not log the message.

[1]: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.log/usage.html#no-more-implicit-conversion-to-unicode-str
[2]: http://bitworking.org/projects/httplib2/doc/html/libhttplib2.html#httplib2.Http.request

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/metadata/namespace_proxy.py
	neutron/tests/unit/agent/metadata/test_namespace_proxy.py

commit_message:
metadata: don't crash proxy on non-unicode user data

We attempt to log every successful metadata response with LOG.debug. But
as per oslo.log docs [1], we should make sure that what we pass into the
library is unicode.

Http.request returns a tuple of Response object and a string, which is
bytes in Python 2.x [2].

That's why we need to convert the response content to unicode before
passing it into oslo.log.

To achieve it, we utilize encodeutils.safe_decode with 'replace' errors
handling strategy, so that we don't get exceptions on input that does
not conform unicode.

For the unit test case, we pass a string that is not expected to convert
to unicode with errors='strict' strategy or similar, and check that we
still don't crash.

While at it, we remove a check for the number of log calls being
triggered, because it's something that we should avoid validating in
test cases, and it cannot trigger a real bug. The mock that was used to
count the number would also hide the bug that we try to reproduce.

Note that the bug does not require debug to be set because the crash
occurs before oslo.log machinery decides it should not log the message.

[1]: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.log/usage.html#no-more-implicit-conversion-to-unicode-str
[2]: http://bitworking.org/projects/httplib2/doc/html/libhttplib2.html#httplib2.Http.request

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/metadata/namespace_proxy.py
	neutron/tests/unit/agent/metadata/test_namespace_proxy.py

Closes-Bug: #1501772
Change-Id: I6a32c40ff117fae43913386134c8981539697ce8
(cherry picked from commit 80e3d9be4923ecad17377b1d15c8392b8a43dac6)
(cherry picked from commit 118a76fd651c19ad098cdee9d0a122a00ddc4e3b)

Currently logging configuration is splitted in two distinct classes,
the init.pp and the logging.pp classes. This review aims to centralize
all logging related parameters in a single class, the logging.pp one.

The impacted parameters are :

  * use_syslog
  * use_stderr
  * log_facility
  * verbose
  * debug
  * log_dir

This change remains backward compatible with what is currently in place.

commit_message:
Support vnic_type, vif_type filters in ml2 port list

portbinding:vnic_type and portbinding:vif_type filters
are presently not supported in ml2 plugin when the
client calls 'neutron port-list'.

This patch supports these filters in the ml2 plugin
_ml2_port_result_filter_hook function.

Change-Id: I514e3b30bc03e17f6e00cd33ce9f42d33f8bb2f5
Closes-bug: #1391806

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-12 10:08:20.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/agents_db.py', 'neutron/common/constants.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/dhcp/agent.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/dhcp/test_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': "Resync L3, DHCP and OVS agents upon revival

In big and busy clusters there could be a condition when
rabbitmq clustering mechanism synchronizes queues and during
this period agents connected to that instance of rabbitmq
can't communicate with the server and server considers them
dead moving resources away. After agent become active again,
it needs to cleanup state entries and synchronize its state
with neutron-server

Closes-Bug: #1505166
Change-Id: I44b7b9fcbcab9330dd645ce876c743b3eaf74c8c
"}]
commit_message:
Resync L3, DHCP and OVS agents upon revival

In big and busy clusters there could be a condition when
rabbitmq clustering mechanism synchronizes queues and during
this period agents connected to that instance of rabbitmq
can't communicate with the server and server considers them
dead moving resources away. After agent become active again,
it needs to cleanup state entries and synchronize its state
with neutron-server

Closes-Bug: #1505166
Change-Id: I44b7b9fcbcab9330dd645ce876c743b3eaf74c8c

commit_message:
Sync deployment tasks on fuel-library upgrade

Simple yum update could break redeployments because
a given task could be changed or deleted. Therefore,
an attempt or warning should be made to update
deployment tasks.

Added explicit dependency on fuelclient.

Change-Id: I06a905aa0bbaefbeb7cbdc60b563f11575bd5bd8
Closes-Bug: #1475530

commit_message:
Fix sysinfo resource declaration

This change replaces the use of clone resources as each node may have a
different disk layout. Additionally this change replaces cs_location
with cs_rsc_location which has a proper autorequire for the cs_resource
being defined.

Change-Id: Ifa8a6932c0f0ba2bc05bc0ea9278cbfbe5ae8bb9
Closes-Bug: #1501410
Closes-Bug: #1504085

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-10-09 16:48:24.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'message': 'Wait for rabbitmq sync before stop/demote actions

Added new OCF key stop_time (corresponding to start_time)
Added wait_sync function which tries until start_time/2
for queues on stopped/demoted node to reach synced state.

Added optional [-t timeout] to su_rabbit_cmd function to
provide arbitrary timeout

Change-Id: Iae2211b3d477a9603a58d5eacb12e0fba924861a
Closes-Bug: #1464637

commit_message:
Wait for rabbitmq sync before stop/demote actions

Added new OCF key stop_time (corresponding to start_time)
Added wait_sync function which tries until start_time/2
for queues on stopped/demoted node to reach synced state.

Added optional [-t timeout] to su_rabbit_cmd function to
provide arbitrary timeout

Change-Id: Iae2211b3d477a9603a58d5eacb12e0fba924861a
Closes-Bug: #1464637

commit_message:
Report error if the choosen algorithm executable is not found

This patch allows Freezer to raise an exception if the user chose
an algorithm whose executable not found in the system and
terminate the backup process

Change-Id: I0c9a8a1daa3b44537677ce0f40ebbca52fddc057
Closes-Bug: #1503203

subject: Do not try to delete server from deleted Heat stack
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-09 22:35:14.000000000', 'files': ['meta/io.murano/Classes/resources/Instance.yaml', 'meta/io.murano/Classes/resources/HeatSWConfigInstance.yaml'], 'message': "Do not try to delete server from deleted Heat stack

Because now Environment's .destroy method would
be called before that of an Instance the later will try
to delete itself from the stack that is physically not
existing and represented as an empty dictionary in
HeatStack.current().

With this change Instance will check stack existence
before deleting anything.

Also a method to check if Instance is present in Heat
stack template was added so that application could check
if it is safe to use the instance (for example to send Agent plans)

Change-Id: I298f3f079a153ef87ed7213b7f1432c9e5e4b4b6
Closes-Bug: #1503715
"}]
commit_message:
Do not try to delete server from deleted Heat stack

Because now Environment's .destroy method would
be called before that of an Instance the later will try
to delete itself from the stack that is physically not
existing and represented as an empty dictionary in
HeatStack.current().

With this change Instance will check stack existence
before deleting anything.

Also a method to check if Instance is present in Heat
stack template was added so that application could check
if it is safe to use the instance (for example to send Agent plans)

Change-Id: I298f3f079a153ef87ed7213b7f1432c9e5e4b4b6
Closes-Bug: #1503715

subject: Revert adding DHCP App by default
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-12 05:53:55.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/multi-node-conf/controller_node_local_controller.conf', 'doc/source/single-node-conf/local_controller.conf', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'dragonflow/controller/df_local_controller.py'], 'message': 'Revert adding DHCP App by default

Currently not having the DHCP service enabled causes errors
in the plugin and also erros in the App as the DHCP port is not

Change-Id: Ic2759663b8bac1add85edd80ad1b416ff15b277e
'}]
commit_message:
Revert adding DHCP App by default

Currently not having the DHCP service enabled causes errors
in the plugin and also erros in the App as the DHCP port is not
created.
This patch temporary remove DHCP app from the default installation
until resolved

Change-Id: Ic2759663b8bac1add85edd80ad1b416ff15b277e

subject: Put all the logging related parameters to the logging class
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-01 08:08:05.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/logging.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_logging_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_init_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Put all the logging related parameters to the logging class

Currently logging configuration is splitted in two distinct classes, the
init.pp and the logging.pp classes. This review aims to centralize all
logging related parameters in a single class, the logging.pp one.

The impacted parameters are :

  * use_syslog
  * use_stderr
  * log_facility
  * verbose
  * debug
  * log_dir

This change remains backward compatible with what is currently in place.

Change-Id: I2e81af8e1739d05cdfb061f22f1100dae699f3d8
'}]
commit_message:
Put all the logging related parameters to the logging class

Currently logging configuration is splitted in two distinct classes, the
init.pp and the logging.pp classes. This review aims to centralize all
logging related parameters in a single class, the logging.pp one.

The impacted parameters are :

  * use_syslog
  * use_stderr
  * log_facility
  * verbose
  * debug
  * log_dir

This change remains backward compatible with what is currently in place.

Change-Id: I2e81af8e1739d05cdfb061f22f1100dae699f3d8

commit_message:
Grab passthrough horizon.allowed_hosts

The tripleo-heat-templates review at
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/221255 adds a HorizonAllowedHosts
parameter. For os-apply-config based deploys make sure this is
set in the horizon image-element etc/horizon/local_settings.py

Depends-On: I5faede8b74a0318e15baa761dc502b95b051ae0d
Change-Id: I0c3de37e4345c5da8b52f6ff664f011376233fe4

commit_message:
aggregates: normalize timestamp

This code is broken with Pandas 0.17 because the timestamps are not all
normalize. This patch fixes that and makes it also compatible with older
Pandas version.

Change-Id: Ie86bb58213a1fc5a25b80b25c330c5f271ebd4ea

subject: Fix TypeError on comparison on Python 3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-06 14:40:58.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/volumes/tabs.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/workflows/create_instance.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/access_and_security/security_groups/views.py', 'openstack_dashboard/contrib/trove/content/database_clusters/forms.py'], 'message': 'Fix TypeError on comparison on Python 3

On Python 3, comparison between None and int or comparison between
dictionaries raises a TypeError.

LaunchForm: use 0 default value instead of None to compare it to 1.

sort() and sorted(): use a key function to compare strings instead of
comparing dictionaries.

Partial-Implements: blueprint porting-python3
Change-Id: I0664c2f6c19c3f105da8b4b5a72cea4eb02c245d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix TypeError on comparison on Python 3

On Python 3, comparison between None and int or comparison between
dictionaries raises a TypeError.

LaunchForm: use 0 default value instead of None to compare it to 1.

sort() and sorted(): use a key function to compare strings instead of
comparing dictionaries.

Partial-Implements: blueprint porting-python3
Change-Id: I0664c2f6c19c3f105da8b4b5a72cea4eb02c245d

commit_message:
Replace 'confirmed' status with MIGRATION_STATUS_CONFIRMED.

Use MIGRATION_STATUS_CONFIRMED to represent the migration status
instead of pure string 'confirmed'.

Change-Id: I0363042ae3be700a1b8de5b027d6533e8fd53633

commit_message:
Replace 'done' status with MIGRATION_STATUS_FINISHED.

Use MIGRATION_STATUS_FINISHED to represent the migration status
instead of pure string 'done'.

'done' status is used only once in the source code, and it is the same
with 'finished'. So reuse MIGRATION_STATUS_FINISHED.

Change-Id: I3136b9e08d79775d8114e7706b4111d7246ad383
Implements: blueprint live-migration-statuses

commit_message:
Replace 'completed' status with MIGRATION_STATUS_FINISHED.

Use MIGRATION_STATUS_FINISHED to represent the migration status
instead of pure string 'completed'.

'completed' and 'finished' statuses are the same. So reuse
MIGRATION_STATUS_FINISHED.

Change-Id: I552e4d579d3b6cc1b201e786e90cf3de02550113

commit_message:
Replace 'running' status with MIGRATION_STATUS_MIGRATING.

Use MIGRATION_STATUS_MIGRATING to represent the migration status
instead of pure string 'running'.

'running' status is only used once in the source code. And it has no difference
with 'migrating'. So reuse the MIGRATION_STATUS_MIGRATING.

Change-Id: If1fda9e0ea84b35a9c987aecc55db588d71745a4
Implements: blueprint live-migration-statuses

commit_message:
Introduce constants to indicate live migration status.

In the current code, live migration statuses (Migration.status) are
represented with pure String. It would be better to define them in
constants because they could also be used by other components.

In Neutron and Cinder, common constants are defined in a directory
named "common". So we can do the same to live migration statuses in
Nova.

The solution is simple: define all live migration statuses in a new
file, nova/common/constants.py.

There are 16 migration statuses in the current code, and they will be
mapped to the constatns as below:
1. preparing            : MIGRATION_STATUS_PREPARING
2. pre-migrating        : MIGRATION_STATUS_PRE_MIGRATING
3. migrating            : MIGRATION_STATUS_MIGRATING
4. running              : MIGRATION_STATUS_MIGRATING
5. post-migrating       : MIGRATION_STATUS_POST_MIGRATING
6. finished             : MIGRATION_STATUS_FINISHED
7. completed            : MIGRATION_STATUS_FINISHED
8. done                 : MIGRATION_STATUS_FINISHED
9. queued               : MIGRATION_STATUS_QUEUED
10. confirming          : MIGRATION_STATUS_CONFIRMING
11. confirmed           : MIGRATION_STATUS_CONFIRMED
12. reverting           : MIGRATION_STATUS_REVERTING
13. reverted            : MIGRATION_STATUS_REVERTED
14. error               : MIGRATION_STATUS_ERROR
15. failed              : MIGRATION_STATUS_FAILED
16. dummy               : MIGRATION_STATUS_DUMMY

I cannot tell the difference between "migrating"(3) and "running"(4),
and the difference among "finished"(6), "completed"(7), and "done"(8).
So for them, only MIGRATION_STATUS_MIGRATING and MIGRATION_STATUS_FINISHED
are defined.

Change-Id: Ie7b12a84e82ebbab3f990a60a7e2fe7dbd3129b6
Implements: blueprint live-migration-statuses

commit_message:
Assert has_calls in tests

Instead of assert_has_calls, tests were wrongly using has_calls.

Corrected the same in this patch.

Also fix bugs in corresponding functions.

Co-Authored-By: Sergey Kraynev <skraynev@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: Idcd44a6833bb4a193767112065ce933deb7d1464

commit_message:
Refactor network availability for node check

Code of NetAssignmentValidator.validate updated with additional check
which determines whether networks in input data can be assigned to node.
The decision is made upon availability of particular net for node group
in which the node is included. The validation is meant to substitute
another check that does the same yet uses already assigned to the node's
nics networks which has produced errorful behavior in some cases (see
the bug's description)

Change-Id: I028b50e32d7bf1b9d02674b861e2e5ff24b4f2d5
Closes-bug: #1425907

subject: [Fix] Get iterations results by their start order
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-07 16:33:25.000000000', 'files': ['rally/task/engine.py', 'tests/unit/task/test_engine.py', 'tests/unit/task/test_runner.py', 'rally/task/runner.py'], 'message': '[Fix] Get iterations results by their start order

Currently iterations results are saved in order of their
completion. For example, we have iterations 1, 2, 3, 4, and
iterations 1 and 3 runs too long, so we could have results
stored in order 2, 4, 1, 3. This causes mistakes in results
analysis.

This patch adds key "iteration" to each iteration result,
and also sorts results with buffering, so we have iterations
in their start order.

Change-Id: I553e8835f766c852d56d86ddca62eebdcff82c04
Closes-Bug: #1492583
'}]
commit_message:
[Fix] Get iterations results by their start order

Currently iterations results are saved in order of their
completion. For example, we have iterations 1, 2, 3, 4, and
iterations 1 and 3 runs too long, so we could have results
stored in order 2, 4, 1, 3. This causes mistakes in results
analysis.

This patch adds key "iteration" to each iteration result,
and also sorts results with buffering, so we have iterations
in their start order.

Change-Id: I553e8835f766c852d56d86ddca62eebdcff82c04
Closes-Bug: #1492583

subject: Simplify rpc_backend parameter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-09 16:49:13.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/manila_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp'], 'message': 'Simplify rpc_backend parameter

It is no longer necessary to specify the whole python namespace
for the backends, and
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.messaging/opts.html lists
the short versions.

This patch maintains backwards compatibility with the previous
default value in case it is explicitly used.

Change-Id: Ie8f298c86266aec249071dc25ce2263c17e65a57
'}]
commit_message:
Simplify rpc_backend parameter

It is no longer necessary to specify the whole python namespace
for the backends, and
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.messaging/opts.html lists
the short versions.

This patch maintains backwards compatibility with the previous
default value in case it is explicitly used.

Change-Id: Ie8f298c86266aec249071dc25ce2263c17e65a57

commit_message:
Pass necessary options to Apache when using WSGI

Keystone recommend to use WSGIApplicationGroup and WSGIPassAuthorization
options when is running under Apache. When WSGIApplicationGroup is not set,
import failures are observed and Keystone doesn't work as expected.

Change-Id: I30483d269f6ae6edcecd376d6814c80c0166b265
Closes-bug: #1502318

options when a service is running under Apache.

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-06-10 03:47:58.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/conductor/test_manager.py', 'ironic/conductor/manager.py', 'etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample', 'ironic/conductor/utils.py'], 'message': "Check timeout when nodes stuck on deploying state

Nodes could be stuck on deploying state if the conductor break
and restart. It's necessary to mark nodes as failed when the
transient(deploying) action timeout. As the conductor restart,
it clears reservation for nodes reserved by this conductor, so
in this case 'reservation=NULL'.

The case that nodes are still reserved by the conductor, is
addressed in next patch.

Partial Bug: #1461937
Change-Id: Ie84b44affb710518e703cc69c217cdd5f64a11f0
"}]
commit_message:
Check timeout when nodes stuck on deploying state

Nodes could be stuck on deploying state if the conductor break
and restart. It's necessary to mark nodes as failed when the
transient(deploying) action timeout. As the conductor restart,
it clears reservation for nodes reserved by this conductor, so
in this case 'reservation=NULL'.

The case that nodes are still reserved by the conductor, is
addressed in next patch.

Partial Bug: #1461937
Change-Id: Ie84b44affb710518e703cc69c217cdd5f64a11f0

commit_message:
Add support to return request_id of last request

Thread local storage is used for storing openstack request ids.

Added method 'store_x_openstack_request_id' which will store request_id
to thread local storage of client. This method is called after request
is made to glance service.

Added method 'get_x_openstack_request_id' which will return request_id
stored in thread local storage of client.

blueprint: expose-get-x-openstack-request-id
Change-Id: I87a5112b3737fb8e8d39412af5eff7647e89c973

commit_message:
Consume sslutils and wsgi modules from oslo.service

sslutils and basic WSGI functionality have been moved to
oslo.service and now Neutron can reuse them.

Marked ssl options that were renamed in oslo.service as
deprecated.

Added a note about possible implications for out-of-tree plugins
to neutron_api.rst

Bumped oslo.service version to 0.9.0.

Related-Bug: #1482633

Depends-On: I0424a6c261fae447dbc25b3abf00258c860a88f5
Change-Id: Ibfdf07e665fcfcd093a0e31274e1a6116706aec2

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4257, 'name': 'Zane Bitter', 'email': 'zbitter@redhat.com', 'username': 'zaneb'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 7582, 'name': 'Jan Provaznik', 'email': 'jan.provaznik@gmail.com', 'username': 'jprovazn'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-01 09:29:03.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/pre_deploy/rhel-registration/environment-rhel-registration.yaml', 'extraconfig/pre_deploy/rhel-registration/scripts/rhel-unregistration', 'extraconfig/pre_deploy/rhel-registration/rhel-registration-resource-registry.yaml', 'extraconfig/pre_deploy/rhel-registration/scripts/rhel-registration', 'extraconfig/pre_deploy/rhel-registration/rhel-registration.yaml', 'extraconfig/post_deploy/rhel-registration/rhel-registration-resource-registry.yaml'], 'message': 'Move RHEL (un)registration to NodeExtraConfig

Currently, we have a problem because the unregistration happens in the
"post deploy" phase, which works fine when the top-level stack is being
deleted, but not when the ResourceGroup of servers is being scaled down,
because then the normal "post deploy" update ordering is respected and
we try to unregister after the corresponding server has been deleted.

So, instead, register/unregister each node inside the unit of scale,
e.g the role template being scaled down, which is possible via the new
NodesExtraConfig interface, which means unregistration will take
place at the right time both on stack delete and on scale-down.

Change-Id: I8f117a49fd128f268659525dd03ad46ba3daa1bc
'}]
commit_message:
Move RHEL (un)registration to NodeExtraConfig

Currently, we have a problem because the unregistration happens in the
"post deploy" phase, which works fine when the top-level stack is being
deleted, but not when the ResourceGroup of servers is being scaled down,
because then the normal "post deploy" update ordering is respected and
we try to unregister after the corresponding server has been deleted.

So, instead, register/unregister each node inside the unit of scale,
e.g the role template being scaled down, which is possible via the new
NodesExtraConfig interface, which means unregistration will take
place at the right time both on stack delete and on scale-down.

Change-Id: I8f117a49fd128f268659525dd03ad46ba3daa1bc

The httpd daemon will be started and managed by Pacemaker, it should
not be enabled by puppet. Ideally, it shouldn't be started either
but it seems it isn't possible with horizon and apache mod_wsgi [1].

1. https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1247547

"}]
commit_message:
Ensure httpd is not enabled by puppet on system boot

The httpd daemon will be started and managed by Pacemaker, it should
not be enabled by puppet. Ideally, it shouldn't be started either
but it seems it isn't possible with horizon and apache mod_wsgi [1].

1. https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1247547

Change-Id: I8a1b23c4ea27ac86385314f6cfde8c49d0879969

commit_message:
Glance image delete output

Previously deleting an already deleted image was throwing the error
of "404 Not Found".With this fix, now the error would be "No image
with a name or ID of '' exists

Change-Id: Ie7b60901619a2336a35890efaa819d34e431a5c8
Closes bug #1333119

commit_message:
Add support for Linux Bonding to os-net-config ifcfg

This change adds support for Linux Bonding to the impl_ifcfg
in os-net-config. This change adds support for configuring Linux
Bonds using the Bonding module rather than Open vSwitch. Most of
the options for Linux Bonds are the same as OVS, with the exception
of bonding_options instead of ovs_options.

Change-Id: If8c6de1554234277843de9fac58536dd5b0a941b

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-10-12 00:36:30.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Add pypi publishing jobs for neutron sub-projects

Make these consistent so we can ensure we're able to publish
releases to pypi. This includes adding pypi-jobs as well as
openstack-publish-jobs.

Note: This excludes the networking-powervm project which has
still not created a PyPi repo yet.

Change-Id: I02ec5166acc91a64ca5e29752c268234e7fbf7cb
Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add pypi publishing jobs for neutron sub-projects

Make these consistent so we can ensure we're able to publish
releases to pypi. This includes adding pypi-jobs as well as
openstack-publish-jobs.

Note: This excludes the networking-powervm project which has
still not created a PyPi repo yet.

Change-Id: I02ec5166acc91a64ca5e29752c268234e7fbf7cb
Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>

commit_message:
Added MAINTAINERS to top-level repo directory

In a consensus reached in a proposal for code review process
change [1], and proposed team structure policy document [2],
adding MAINTAINERS files in repositories.

Please note, that this file is written in YAML format in order
to allow further automation around code review process.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-August/072406.html
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/225376/1

Change-Id: I54c2ad8f36e88570ad545968933474fc207acc75

commit_message:
Add _needs_update() to AWS::EC2::EIPAssociation

This will enable update-preview to see if the resource will be replaced
during a particular stack-update.

Also, a bit of redundant code was deleted.

Change-Id: Ib368d2edddac6b968e16db9f8e7128ac30ff764f
Partial-Bug: #1494436

commit_message:
Add how to use in Ironic Section

Since Ironic is an integration project now. We should add one section
about it in Admin guide.
This commit is part of the bugfix since adding the whole section is
huge. This one is to add the sequence of how to use Ironic.

Change-Id: I35176fcec960110bfe62c68251a1dfd5d0d828cf

subject: Use request helpers for token_info/token_auth
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-10-07 23:32:47.000000000', 'files': ['keystonemiddleware/auth_token/_request.py', 'keystonemiddleware/tests/unit/auth_token/test_request.py', 'keystonemiddleware/auth_token/__init__.py'], 'message': "Use request helpers for token_info/token_auth

There is already a request setter for token_auth that we aren't using
and should be. Also add a setter for token_info rather than set the
environment directly.

This makes it much easier to consume these values later in objects that
subclass BaseAuthProtocol.

Change-Id: I7f4bf2950f783e4dc85a5671def6a02322cd7f8a
"}]
commit_message:
Use request helpers for token_info/token_auth

There is already a request setter for token_auth that we aren't using
and should be. Also add a setter for token_info rather than set the
environment directly.

This makes it much easier to consume these values later in objects that
subclass BaseAuthProtocol.

Change-Id: I7f4bf2950f783e4dc85a5671def6a02322cd7f8a

commit_message:
Add support for image metadata namespace (Juno)

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/glance/glancemetadefcatalogapi.html
Adding API support for glance namespace create delete and list

- Added md_namespace_create , md_namespace_delete and
  md_namespace_list
- Added test for create_metadefs_namespace and delete
- Added test for list_metadefs_namespaces

I am planning to commit more API commands for namespace support.

Depends-On: I87a5b560285d4520faa3c58968343f15abfc480f
Change-Id: I62710c7c0a2dde34f16845186eb92f915e925119

commit_message:
Have the executor stats object repr look like the watcher repr

Avoid having different repr styles and just unify the executor
stats one to look like the one used in the watcher object, which
is the style more commonly used in other libraries also.

Change-Id: Ibd98094371f57ecb8bca78b8446ca28727da84e9

commit_message:
Fix tests giving erroneous output during os-testr run

After the switch to os-testr more output is given in console during
the tests run. Some output is stderr due to mistakes in
mocking/logging. This change fixes such tests.

Change-Id: I074c0f3aeb08df04ca9efcf34a7a49415567f466
Closes-bug: #1504524

commit_message:
Fix agent_ilo to remove temporary images

agent_ilo driver doesn't cleanup the temporary
files created. This commit makes sure
that the temporary files are cleaned up before
the server goes for second boot.

Closes-bug: #1503795

Change-Id: I6cce1d1f3a5631e1af992c173379927fed3c55a1

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-10 21:05:48.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_backups.py'], 'message': "Add unspecified options to backup unittests

The backup runner unittests have been intermittently failing
because some of the backup commands being returned don't include
gzip in the pipeline.

The problem is that the tests all use the same instance of the
BackupRunner and the is_zipped instance variable is being
altered by the various tests. Each test that is expecting
compression and/or encryption needs to set these variables
explicitly. If not, depending on the timing and ordering of
the tests, the variables may not be set as the test expects.

Put defaults for the variables (true) into the setup() method.
Removed code in the tests that set is_zipped or is_encrypted
to true and will rely on the defaults in setup() for these.

Change-Id: I74431aefe88e1aea15ca5160a6cb597b59d19fbd
Closes-bug: 1500199
"}]
commit_message:
Add unspecified options to backup unittests

The backup runner unittests have been intermittently failing
because some of the backup commands being returned don't include
gzip in the pipeline.

The problem is that the tests all use the same instance of the
BackupRunner and the is_zipped instance variable is being
altered by the various tests. Each test that is expecting
compression and/or encryption needs to set these variables
explicitly. If not, depending on the timing and ordering of
the tests, the variables may not be set as the test expects.

Put defaults for the variables (true) into the setup() method.
Removed code in the tests that set is_zipped or is_encrypted
to true and will rely on the defaults in setup() for these.

Change-Id: I74431aefe88e1aea15ca5160a6cb597b59d19fbd
Closes-bug: 1500199

commit_message:
Allow RBD host to be configurable

Most sites using ceph with cinder are going to have already set the host
value.  This change allows those sites to override the default and not
break existing volumes.  It also moves the tests cases from the volume
class to the backend define.  Lastly, it renames the parameter from host
to backend_host, since host is deprecated with Kilo.

Change-Id: I43e4d3b7ae1672ea0c551c6c7267f0c38bb9842f

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-10-06 15:41:53.000000000', 'files': ['bandit/core/issue.py', 'tests/unit/core/test_util.py', 'bandit/bandit.py', 'bandit/core/utils.py'], 'message': 'Fixing -n behaviour

The old default of -1 to mean "all lines of context" was
none-sensical and has been removed, all lines of context
would be the entire file.

A new default of 3 is used now, to give a line before and
a line after the issue. This is correctly adjustable by the
-n command line option.

Change-Id: I0299e2ff260ae67936342feacb1a30d51bfd55a8
closes-bug: 1497771
'}]
commit_message:
Fixing -n behaviour

The old default of -1 to mean "all lines of context" was
none-sensical and has been removed, all lines of context
would be the entire file.

A new default of 3 is used now, to give a line before and
a line after the issue. This is correctly adjustable by the
-n command line option.

Change-Id: I0299e2ff260ae67936342feacb1a30d51bfd55a8
closes-bug: 1497771

Documents changes for the multiple local subnet support on IPSec
site-to-site connections. This new capability uses the endpoint
groups API, on which this commit is based.

Changes include:

- The subnet ID is now optional (and deprecated) for the VPN service API.
- The peer CIDR attribute is deprecated and replaced by local and peer
  endpoint group IDs (former for subnets, and latter for CIDRs) for
  the site-to-site connection API.
- Commit I0cdded5105ad8000131e39a86cbfa80ed89ae37b added external IP
  address reporting for the VPN service, and that includes IPv4 and
  IPv6 addresses in the show VPN service output. Along with updated
  examples, the fields were added and sample information was updated
  for this feature.

Related-Bug: #1459423
Closes-Bug: #1504881

Change-Id: Ib19a50b069b74b30f81f515390151925e7fd6366
'}]
commit_message:
VPNaaS: Multiple Local Subnet API documentation

Documents changes for the multiple local subnet support on IPSec
site-to-site connections. This new capability uses the endpoint
groups API, on which this commit is based.

Changes include:

- The subnet ID is now optional (and deprecated) for the VPN service API.
- The peer CIDR attribute is deprecated and replaced by local and peer
  endpoint group IDs (former for subnets, and latter for CIDRs) for
  the site-to-site connection API.
- Commit I0cdded5105ad8000131e39a86cbfa80ed89ae37b added external IP
  address reporting for the VPN service, and that includes IPv4 and
  IPv6 addresses in the show VPN service output. Along with updated
  examples, the fields were added and sample information was updated
  for this feature.

Related-Bug: #1459423
Closes-Bug: #1504881

Change-Id: Ib19a50b069b74b30f81f515390151925e7fd6366

The correct order expected by testtools is
assertEqual(expected, observed).

This patch fix the issue in the module /tests/unit/queues/v1 of zaqarclient.
Partial-Bug: #1259292

Change-Id: Ia5969d904012647f29b5047e37cad9ce3a77a489

commit_message:
Save updated-in-place resources to backup stack

The patch changes the approach of resource backup during stack
update. It stores the definition of resource that needs to be
updated in-place to backup stack(if it was not created before).

Without this functionality, InvalidTemplateReference will be thrown
every time when update-replaced resource has a reference to updated
in-place resource and stack update was failed. In this case, backup
stack has a resource that refers to not-presented another resource
and backup stack deletion generates an exception.

Change-Id: I436c44a579bb4df3031d1a17b9ca5b62da37afeb
Closes-bug: #1446575
(cherry picked from commits da3777342a344a2dafb9244b7afca8722a398caa
                        and 3786262aed62d81ad35de3d4f703c38223907ffd)
